0.title: 4 arrested for cheating finance company of ₹4.6 crore in Gujarat
0.article_body: Ahmedabad Police's DCB arrested four persons for allegedly cheating a finance company of ₹4.6 crore which they had sought to purchase land on behalf of unsuspecting customers. According to police, Parbat Rabari, owner of a builder company, Rishabh Yagnik, the then general manager at the loan finance company, Kalpesh Prajapati, a valuer and Dilip Shah, a broker were arrested.

1.title: Russian ICBM test 'routine' and 'not a threat', says US
1.article_body: Russia "properly" notified the US ahead of its test launch of the intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), the Pentagon said, adding the test was "routine" and "not a threat to the US or its allies". On Wednesday, Russia conducted a first test launch of its Sarmat ICBM. Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the missile can hit any target on Earth.

2.title: Apple store workers in Atlanta file for firm's 1st US union election
2.article_body: Workers at an Apple store in Atlanta have filed for a union election with the NLRB. If a majority of the workers vote to unionise, the store would be the first unionised US Apple store. "We want to make sure...every Apple worker is able to afford quality housing and basic living expenses," an Apple worker said.

3.title: Lack of coordination among NDA led to BJP's defeat in Bochahan bypoll: JD(U) leader
3.article_body: JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said that "lack of coordination among NDA partners" led to the recent defeat of BJP in Bochahan assembly seat by-election in Bihar. "The BJP's central leadership should intervene and consider the JD(U)'s long-standing demand for a coordination committee in Bihar," he added. RJD candidate Amar Kumar Paswan won the Bochahan election by margin of 36,617 votes.

4.title: Military hospitals, cantonments to get Ayurveda centres: Govt
4.article_body: The ministries of Defence and Ayush have agreed to set up Ayurveda centres at 12 military hospitals and 37 cantonments across the country. The centres will come up in Agra, Dalhousie, Jhansi, Jammu, Jalandhar and Delhi. The MoUs were signed during the Global Ayush Investment and Innovation Summit in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, which was attended by PM Narendra Modi.

5.title: Supreme Court halts Jahangirpuri demolition drive for 2 weeks
5.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed demolition drive in Jahangirpuri for two weeks, saying, "We will take a serious view of all demolitions that took place after the status quo order was communicated to the mayor." On Wednesday, the demolition, which started around 10.15 am, went on for two hours despite SC's directions at 11 am that status quo be maintained.

6.title: Fraudsters impersonate Tripura minister, ask for money on WhatsApp
6.article_body: Unknown fraudsters reportedly impersonated Tripura Information and Cultural Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury and tried to con his contacts. The racketeers reportedly asked for money from his contacts, including several officials through WhatsApp messages. "The cyber-crime unit of the Tripura Police...is investigating the issue," a statement issued by Chowdhury's office said.

7.title: Video of woman giving birth in torchlight in Odisha goes viral, probe on
7.article_body: A probe was initiated after a video of a woman giving birth under the torchlight of a mobile phone due to power outage in Odisha's Ganjam district went viral. “Delivery could not have been delayed...I had to conduct the delivery under a cellphone torch as there was no generator or inverter facility available at the CHC," Dr Pragyan Prathama said.

8.title: Tripura govt announces health insurance scheme for journalists
8.article_body: Tripura government on Wednesday approved a health insurance scheme of ₹3 lakh for accredited journalists associated with print, web and electronic media organisations. According to Information and Cultural Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury, journalists in the age group of 21-65 years will be considered eligible for the scheme. At present, Tripura has 177 accredited journalists, Chowdhury said.

9.title: It wasn't with Anurag Kashyap, speculation unethical: Mandana on 'secret relationship'
9.article_body: After revealing on 'Lock Upp' that she was in a secret relationship with a director following her split with husband, Mandana Karimi said that it wasn't with Anurag Kashyap as being speculated. "How can people play with names...It's not done. It's very unethical and unfortunate," she said. Mandana added that she and Anurag are friends.

10.title: When I'd try to leave, she'd scream 'I am going to die': Depp on ex-wife Amber Heard
10.article_body: While testifying in defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, actor Johnny Depp said, "Many times when I'd try to leave, she'd stop me, cry and scream." He added, "[She'd say] 'I can't live without you. I am going to die'." Depp added that Amber would follow him when he'd leave and scream in his parking lot.

11.title: UK PM tries his hands on charkha at Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat
11.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson tried his hands on charkha at Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat as he arrived in India for a two-day visit. "It is an immense privilege to come to the Ashram of this extraordinary man, and to understand how he mobilised such simple principles of truth and non-violence to change the world for the better," he wrote.

12.title: CSK, MI don't have top-order bowlers, that's why they're at the bottom: Ajay Jadeja
12.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said the lack of "top-order" bowlers has been one of the reasons why both CSK and MI are at the bottom of IPL points table. "CSK are not known for making many changes. An out-and-out fast bowler could have helped, but it's late now," he added. MI are winless in their six games in IPL 2022.

13.title: They threatened to enter my bedroom: Ex-Pak PM's ex-wife on video of Sharif's supporters
13.article_body: Supporters of former Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif threatened to enter the bedroom of Imran Khan's ex-wife Jemima Goldsmith during a protest in London. Jemima shared a video on Twitter and wrote, "What is this protestor on the right outside my mother's house miming after threatening to enter my bedroom?"

14.title: Not sure how it got through review: Binance on its swastika-like emoji
14.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance took to Twitter to react to the issue surrounding an emoji it unveiled earlier, saying, "Well that was...really embarrassing. We're not sure how that emoji got through...layers of review without anyone noticing." Several users had pointed out the emoji's resemblance to swastika symbol used by Nazis. "We immediately flagged the issue, pulled it down," Binance added.

15.title: Woman gets calls seeking sexual favours as 3 men write number on K'taka toilet walls
15.article_body: A woman received over 500 calls seeking sexual favours after three of her colleagues scribbled her contact number and email address on the walls of public toilets and bus stands in many places in Karnataka. The accused had also sent obscene WhatsApp messages to the victim. A lecturer is among those arrested by the police.

16.title: I would like to do a comedy film with dad: Shraddha on Shakti Kapoor
16.article_body: Shraddha Kapoor said she wants to do a movie with her father-actor Shakti Kapoor and also added that she'd like to do a comedy film with him. She said, "He's constantly making us laugh in the house. It would be lovely to share screen space with him." Shraddha added that she is very inspired by her father and his work.

17.title: 23 of 105 parties eligible to encash electoral bonds: RTI response
17.article_body: Of the 105 political parties that submitted data regarding receiving electoral bonds to the ECI, 23 are eligible to receive and encash these, data shared under the RTI Act stated. In response to an RTI application, SBI said only 23 political parties have opened a special current account made for redeeming and encashing electoral bonds as of March this year.

18.title: Mathura temple shuts loudspeakers after UP govt order
18.article_body: Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi temple complex in UP's Mathura decided to switch off the loudspeakers after the state government issued directives on the use of sound systems at religious places. All 'bhajans' and 'kirtans' (prayers) will now be played at low levels so that the sound does not go beyond the complex, said a temple official.

19.title: Those criticising PM are premature babies born in 3rd month: Bhagyaraj
19.article_body: Actor Bhagyaraj called the people criticising Prime Minister Narendra Modi "premature babies born in the third month of pregnancy". "Why we should think that they were born in the third month is because...in fourth month...mouth is formed...and ear is formed...in fifth month. I call these people premature babies...because they will neither talk good nor listen to good things," he added.

20.title: I moved to Mumbai, thought 'why does everyone love SRK, why don't I': Shehnaaz
20.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill said that when she moved to Mumbai, she wondered why everyone loves actor Shah Rukh Khan. "I wondered why don't I love him...I watched his films and then I became his fan," she said, adding that she used to live in her own world while she was in Punjab before moving to Mumbai.

21.title: Please consider working at Boring Company: Musk as it raises $675 mn
21.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to his startup The Boring Company raising $675 million at a valuation of nearly $6 billion, saying, "Please consider working at The Boring Company!" "Our goal is to solve traffic, which plagues every major city on Earth," he added. The startup's funding was led by Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital.

22.title: Owaisi has Jinnah's DNA, believes in Sharia law: Giriraj Singh
22.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi for comparing Delhi's Jahangirpuri anti-encroachment drive with Turkman Gate incident during the Emergency and said that leaders like Owaisi view all issues through "Hindu versus Muslim angle". "They do so because they have Jinnah's DNA and believe in Sharia law, not the law of the land," Singh added.

23.title: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla inaugurates 4 India-Vietnam flights
23.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Wednesday inaugurated four new flights between India and Vietnam. These flights will help boost the economies of both the countries and increase business and tourism opportunities, Birla said. The new flights will operate between Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City and Mumbai as well as from Phu Quoc to New Delhi and Mumbai.

24.title: 6 people killed as plane crashes onto busy Haitian street
24.article_body: At least six people, including the pilot, have been killed after a small plane crashed onto a busy street in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince on Wednesday, officials said. The plane had reportedly crashed due to an engine failure. Haitian PM Ariel Henry said he was saddened by the crash and offered his sympathies to the families of the victims.

25.title: Rohit Sharma is not going through a bad patch like Kohli: Manjrekar
25.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said that MI captain Rohit Sharma is "hitting good 20s and whenever he plays he looks in good touch". He added, "[Rohit's lack of runs] is not a bad patch like Virat Kohli's, who's not looking in good form. Rohit's machinery looks in top condition but then he gets out suddenly."

26.title: 2 owners of Gurugram guest house booked for using Ex-DCP's forged signature
26.article_body: Police have booked two owners of a guest house in Gurugram for using forged signature of former DCP-East Maqsood Ahmed in the facility's arrival-departure register. The matter came to light when  police personnel found Ahmed's signature on a certificate pasted on the first page of the register. On further investigation, the police found out the certificate to be fake.

27.title: Surprised that the no. 3 spot has been a rolling chair for LSG: Jaffer
27.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he is "surprised" to see that the number three position has been a "rolling chair" for LSG. "Sometimes Manish Pandey [bats] at that spot, Krishnappa Gowtham came against RR and Jason Holder was promoted to that spot as well," added Jaffer. "LSG have not used Ayush Badoni well in the last few matches," stated Jaffer.

28.title: Taiwan says 11 Chinese warplanes entered its air defence zone
28.article_body: Taiwan on Wednesday said that as many as 11 Chinese military aircraft entered its air defence zone. In response, Taiwan dispatched its air patrol forces, issued radio warnings and deployed air defence missile systems to monitor the activities of the intruding aircraft, said the country's defence ministry in a statement. The ministry also released a list of the aircraft.

29.title: My kids just want to know why I don't score a hundred: David Warner
29.article_body: On being asked what his kids tell him after he gets out, DC opener David Warner said, "They just want to know why I don't score a hundred." "They keep watching Jos Buttler score hundreds. They ask me, 'Why can't you hit the ball out of the park like him?'" Warner added. Warner has hit three consecutive fifties in IPL.

30.title: 4 US Amazon drivers sue firm over being stuck in warehouse amid tornado
30.article_body: Four US Amazon drivers have sued the firm after they sustained injuries while they were stuck in a warehouse amid a tornado in December. Amazon allegedly threatened to fire employees who tried to leave the facility and seek shelter at home. A separate lawsuit was filed on behalf of the mother of deceased worker DeAndre Morrow.

31.title: State-sponsored targeting of minorities: Rahul on Jahangirpuri demolition drive
31.article_body: Reacting to the demolition drive in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri area, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that the act was a “state-sponsored targeting of poor and minorities”. "This is demolition of India’s constitutional values…BJP must bulldoze the hatred in their hearts instead," Gandhi added. Meanwhile, Congress’ Shashi Tharoor said that the demolition drive was "illegal".

32.title: Mango sticky rice sales sharply rise in Thailand as rapper eats it on stage in US
32.article_body: Thai rapper Milli's performance has led to a sharp rise in mango sticky rice sales in Thailand after she ate it on stage at California's Coachella festival. The 19-year-old rapper became the first Thai to perform solo at Coachella festival. Thai government said it may send a proposal for the rice to be listed as a UNESCO cultural heritage item.

33.title: 1 dead, 4 injured as electric scooter battery explodes in room in T'gana
33.article_body: An 80-year-old man died and four others were injured after an electric scooter battery exploded while being charged at their home in Telangana's Nizamabad, police said. The deceased and two others were sleeping in the room where the battery exploded, police added. A case was registered against a Hyderabad-based startup that had manufactured the scooter and the dealer, police stated.

34.title: Man sentenced to death for rape, murder of 7-yr-old girl in Bhiwandi
34.article_body: Thane Sessions Court on Wednesday sentenced a 30-year-old man to death for raping and killing a seven-year-old girl. The incident occurred in December 2019 when the accused, who was known to the deceased, kidnapped her and took her to a secluded place in Bhiwandi. He then raped the girl and smashed her head with a stone.

35.title: I'm enjoying my bowling after a long time and credit goes to Pant: Kuldeep
35.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who's currently the second-highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL season with 13 wickets in six games, has said he's enjoying his bowling after a long time. "The credit...goes to Rishabh Pant for the way he backs his spinners. This gives a lot of confidence...I've been given a lot of confidence in this IPL," he stated.

36.title: Mumbai woman tweets about neighbour molesting elder daughter, tags police
36.article_body: A Mumbai woman took to Twitter to say that her elder daughter was molested my her neighbour on March 28. "After spending more than 6 hours in Bandra Police Station, no FIR filed on my complaint...There after I gave...written complaint to DCP sir and ACP sir, till date no action," she wrote. She tagged Mumbai Police Commissioner in tweet.

37.title: 72 foreigners held for involvement in narcotics trade in HP from 2017-21: Police data
37.article_body: From 2017 to 2021, a total of 72 foreign nationals have been arrested for their involvement in the narcotics trade in Himachal Pradesh, according to state police data. During this period, half of the total foreign nationals arrested for involvement in illegal drugs smuggling in the state are from Nigeria, according to the data.

38.title: Used to be 90 kgs before my acting debut; I was very self-conscious: Sonia
38.article_body: Actress Sonia Rathee, who starred in 'Broken But Beautiful 3', revealed she was overweight before making her acting debut and worked extremely hard to get in shape. She said, "I used to be 90 kgs and...[was] very self-conscious." "I worked on myself...took acting classes, got roles in off-broadway plays and became a full-time actress in New York first," she added.

39.title: 4 labourers kill co-worker, dump body in drain in Pune; arrested
39.article_body: Police arrested four labourers in Pune for allegedly killing their colleague and dumping his body in a drain in a gunny bag, with his limbs tied together. The men were reportedly drinking in a room when a fight broke out and the victim was beaten to death. Police arrested the accused on Tuesday after the body was found on Monday.

40.title: G20 members walk out of meeting over Russia’s participation
40.article_body: Several members walked out of a G20 meeting held in Washington DC over the participation of Russia against the backdrop of the Ukraine war. The representatives from the US, Ukraine, Britain, France and Canada boycotted the meeting when Russian officials started to speak. Many of the members attending the meeting virtually turned off their cameras.

41.title: Amazon, SpaceX, others bag $278.5 mn in NASA communications deal
41.article_body: Amazon's Project Kuiper, SpaceX's Starlink network and four others have won a combined $278.5 million in contracts from NASA to begin developing and demonstrating near-Earth space communication services that may support future missions. Kuiper won $67 million, while Starlink received $70 million. Each company is expected to complete the development and demonstrations of its satellites by 2025.

42.title: Accused in attempt to murder case gets bail in MP, asked to plant trees
42.article_body: An accused in an attempt to murder case was granted bail by Gwalior bench of Madhya Pradesh High Court on condition of planting 10 trees. The accused, who said he would do community service voluntarily, must produce pictures of the plants within 30 days and keep the court updated about their health for the next six months, the court said.

43.title: India now identified with minority persecution, Islamophobia: Tharoor
43.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor criticised Centre for carrying out anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and called the action "unconstitutional". "India's image is going downhill...Everything I hear from my friends abroad is deeply negative. We're being identified with minority persecution and Islamophobia," he said. "Government's job is to build up the nation, not bulldoze it down," he added.

44.title: Mother who flung baby girl out of hospital in Mumbai gets life term
44.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was given life imprisonment by a Mumbai court, nearly 12 years after she had flung her baby girl out of a window in KEM Hospital. A security guard, one of witnesses in the case, said that he heard a baby crying and on reaching the spot, he found that the infant's right ear was bleeding.

45.title: Retired colonel, wife found dead in Pune home, bore rifle wounds found
45.article_body: A 75-year-old retired colonel and his 63-year-old wife were found dead in their house in Pune's Mundhwa on Wednesday. Gunshot wounds were also found on their bodies. "The wounds are by a bore rifle...Prima facie it appears that the woman was killed by husband before he shot himself" said Namrata Patil, Deputy Commissioner of Police, zone 5 of Pune police.

46.title: India is indebted to sacrifices of Sikh gurus: Amit Shah
46.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said that the country is indebted to the sacrifices of the Sikh gurus and it is due to their supreme sacrifice that we are a free country today. Shah participated in the celebration of the 400th Parkash Purab of Guru Tegh Bahadur at the Red Fort in Delhi yesterday.

47.title: Mamaearth announces OMG Sale with Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer
47.article_body: Mamaearth has announced its OMG (Oh My Goodness) Sale with Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer that's currently live on the Mamaearth app and website. Users can add two of their favourite skincare, haircare, and baby care products to the cart and get one product for free. To avail offer, use coupon code OMG at checkout.

48.title: Ex-national para swimming champ Amartya dies at 19, father says 'Nobody came for help'
48.article_body: Amartya Chakraborty, a three-time former national para swimming champion, passed away aged 19 at a hospital in Delhi. Amartya, who hailed from Salkia in West Bengal's Howrah district, had deformed fingers and suffered from multiple diseases. His father Amitosh said they sought financial help from Paralympic Committee of India and Sports Ministry for Amartya's treatment, but "nobody came for help".

49.title: After 1st film I was all over the place, wasn't easy to digest fame: Ayushmann
49.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that it was difficult for him to digest fame after his first film. "After my first film, I was all over the place...After six-seven months, I realised that you have to give time to your friends and family...I still try my best to strike that balance but it's difficult," he added.

50.title: There's a lot of out of the box thinking: Manjrekar on Pant's captaincy
50.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has praised DC captain Rishabh Pant's leadership after their nine-wicket win over PBKS. Manjrekar pointed out how Pant handled Shardul Thakur after the PBKS batters attacked him, scoring 20 runs off his first two overs, and introduced spinners to take wickets. Pant gave the ball to Lalit Yadav, who dismissed Shikhar Dhawan in the fourth over.

51.title: Bowlers did a fantastic job, made it easier for us: Warner after win vs PBKS
51.article_body: DC opener David Warner said their bowlers did a fantastic job, restricting PBKS to 115 runs. "[Our] bowlers made it easier for us...for me, it's about sticking to the basics and I tried to put my best footwork forward," he added. Warner remained unbeaten at 60 runs to help DC chase down the target in 10.3 overs.

52.title: 2 minor boys drown in pit while taking bath in Gurugram
52.article_body: Two minor boys, aged nine and ten, drowned to death in a pit on Tuesday while taking a bath in Gurugram's Bajghera village, police said. They were brought out by their family members and villagers, and were taken to a hospital but died, police added. One of the victims was a native of Assam and the other of Bihar.

53.title: Jharkhand leaders urge Guv to disqualify BJP MLA over caste certificate
53.article_body: A delegation of Congress, RJD and JMM leaders on Tuesday submitted a memorandum to Jharkhand Governor Ramesh Bais seeking the disqualification of BJP MLA Sammari Lal over his caste certificate. "Since Sammari Lal is a resident of Rajasthan, he is not qualified to get his caste certificate made from Jharkhand," said the memorandum.

54.title: 11-yr-old boy survives landslide by hiding in fridge for 20 hours in Philippines
54.article_body: A Filipino boy survived a landslide by hiding in a refrigerator for 20 hours in what authorities are calling an "absolute miracle". The 11-year-old suffered a broken leg during the ordeal and was taken to a hospital. Authorities said that his mother and younger sibling are still missing, while his father died in another landslide.

55.title: Jersey director said, 'After seeing your dad's shot, nobody will look at you': Shahid
55.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said his film Jersey's director Gowtam Tinnanuri was worried that people will not notice his character in the film because of his father, Pankaj Kapur. "He said, 'After seeing your dad's take, you think anybody is going to look at you...He's so good, he'll pull all the audience, nobody will be interested in you'," Shahid added.

56.title: COVID-19 cases in India see 15% jump over yesterday as 2,380 people test positive
56.article_body: India reported 2,380 COVID-19 cases and 56 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,067 COVID-19 cases and 40 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 13,433, while the death toll has risen to 5,22,062.

57.title: Nowadays sob stories on reality shows look fake; Boogie Woogie was real: Jaaved
57.article_body: When asked his opinion on reality shows today, actor Jaaved Jaaferi said, "All of them are looking the same. It (the sob stories) looks fake." He added that what made 'Boogie Woogie' stand out was the fact that everything that happened on the show "was organic, real, from the heart and not scripted". "Our reactions would come naturally," he said.

58.title: Elon Musk's Boring Company raises $675 mn at $6 bn valuation
58.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk-led The Boring Company has raised $675 million in a funding round led by Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital. The round has valued the startup at nearly $6 billion. The funding also saw participation from Valor Equity Partners, Founders Fund, 8VC, Craft Ventures, and DFJ Growth. The startup had last raised $120 million three years ago.

59.title: UK PM Boris Johnson arrives in India for two-day visit
59.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Thursday arrived in Ahmedabad for a two-day visit. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and other senior officers welcomed him at the airport. Johnson on Wednesday had said that the visit would deepen the "strategic trade, defence and people-to-people ties between our two countries". Johnson will hold talks with PM Narendra Modi on April 22.

60.title: Kidnapper kills 8-yr-old in Pune's Chikhali after he starts crying, held
60.article_body: A 26-year-old man, identified as Bapil Ahmed Raees Lashkar, was arrested days after dead body of an eight-year-old boy with severe head trauma was found in Pune's Chikhali. The accused, who was a former neighbour of the deceased, had allegedly kidnapped him on April 16 to demand a ransom. After the boy started crying, Lashkar reportedly bludgeoned him to death.

61.title: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani arrested by Assam Police: Congress
61.article_body: Gujarat's Vadgam MLA Jignesh Mevani was arrested by Assam Police on Wednesday from the Palanpur Circuit House, Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee chief Jagdish Thakor said. "Police took Mevani to Assam by train from Ahmedabad at 4 am," he added. "We have been informed about some case filed against him in Assam," Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar tweeted.

62.title: Bulldozers should be run on BJP headquarters, Amit Shah's residence: Atishi
62.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Atishi took to Twitter to say, "Bulldozers should be run on the BJP headquarters...and on...residence of Amit Shah. After this, riots will not take place in...the country." Meanwhile, Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said, "BJP has created an atmosphere of anarchy in the country." The comments came after demolition drive was carried out in Jahangirpuri.

63.title: Need to be alert about children’s health: CM Yogi as COVID cases surge
63.article_body: As COVID-19 cases surged in parts of Uttar Pradesh, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed the officials to keep a watch on children's health. "We need to be alert with regard to children's health," CM Yogi said in a meeting. He also asked officials to fasten the vaccination process and ensure that COVID protocols are followed in the schools.

64.title: 3 arrested for harassing woman lecturer in Karnataka
64.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly harassing a 58-year-old woman lecturer in Karnataka by writing her contact information on public toilets in several places. The accused, which included a 36-year-old economics lecturer, are also said to have sent obscene WhatsApp messages to the victim. The matter came to light when the woman started getting calls seeking sexual favours.

65.title: Ackman sells $1.1 bn Netflix stock at $400 mn loss after shares fall 35%
65.article_body: Billionaire Bill Ackman has sold his entire stock worth $1.1 billion in Netflix at over $400 million loss three months after acquiring the position. Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. "We have lost confidence in our ability to predict the company's future prospects with a sufficient degree of certainty," Ackman said.

66.title: Mumbai man duped of ₹1.44 lakh by fraudster posing as Delhi Police Commissioner
66.article_body: A 71-year-old man from Mumbai was cheated of ₹1.44 lakh by a fraudster posing as Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana. According to police, the victim received a call from the fraudster saying his obscene video had been uploaded on social media and that he would be arrested. The accused and his accomplice then demanded money to delete the said video.

67.title: Shahid's fans will hate me for not supporting him in 'Jersey': Mrunal
67.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming film 'Jersey', which also stars actor Shahid Kapoor, actress Mrunal Thakur said, "Shahid Kapoor's fans will hate me for not supporting him, but the reason will be justified when you watch the film." "There are no similarities between Mrunal and Vidya. A lot of qualities of Vidya are derived from my mother," she added.

68.title: Mumbai man held for using intimate photos of ex-girlfriend to get her business share
68.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 20-year-old man for threatening his ex-girlfriend using her private photos and forcing her to give up her business share. The woman, who is a partner in a pathology lab business, said that he clicked some photos with her earlier and is now threatening to spread them if she didn't agree to give up her profit share.

69.title: Negotiating with Putin is like dealing with a 'crocodile': UK PM ahead of India visit
69.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has said it's unlikely that Ukraine and Russia can make peace through negotiations, comparing talks with Russian leader Vladimir Putin to dealing with a "crocodile". "How can you negotiate with a crocodile when it's got your leg in its jaws?" Johnson said on a flight to India.

70.title: 2 habitual two-wheeler offenders apprehended in Hyd, 16 bikes seized
70.article_body: Hyderabad's Uppal Police apprehended two habitual two-wheeler offenders and recovered 16 bikes worth ₹6 lakh from them, Rachakonda Police tweeted. The accused persons are classmates and are pursuing intermediate 2nd year, police added. They have been committing thefts since December 2021, police stated. In another case, police arrested two offenders involved in automobile theft.

71.title: Speed up road repair work in 110 villages: BBMP chief to officials
71.article_body: Speed up road repairs in 110 villages where Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board has finished work related to laying water and sanitary lines, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta instructed officials. BBMP has finished restoring 289.69 km of roads, while 505.29 km are still pending, Gupta said. Restoration work must be completed by May-end, he added.

72.title: Priyanka and Nick's baby girl named Malti Marie Chopra Jonas, reveals birth certificate
72.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra and singer Nick Jonas' baby girl has been named Malti Marie Chopra Jonas, as per the birth certificate obtained by TMZ. Priyanka and Nick had welcomed Malti Marie via surrogate on January 15 at a hospital in San Diego, California, the certificate also revealed. The couple announced her birth on January 22.

73.title: DC record their highest-ever score in powerplay in IPL history
73.article_body: DC on Wednesday recorded their highest-ever score in powerplay in IPL history after scoring 81 runs against PBKS in the first six overs. Their previous highest powerplay score in IPL came on May 19, 2008, when they scored 71 runs against RCB. They recorded their third-highest powerplay score of 70 against PBKS on April 23, 2011.

74.title: Aishwarya, Abhishek Bachchan share throwback pic from wedding on anniversary
74.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan and actress Aishwarya Rai took to their respective Instagram accounts to share a throwback picture from their wedding day on occasion of their wedding anniversary. Both of them shared the same picture in which Abhishek can be seen putting a ring on Aishwarya's finger. Both Abhishek and Aishwarya's mehendi-clad hands are visible in picture.

75.title: F1 driver Charles Leclerc's watch worth ₹2.5 crore stolen while posing for group photo
75.article_body: F1 driver Charles Leclerc had his watch worth €300,000 (around ₹2.5 crore) stolen while posing for a group photo with fans in Italy's Tuscany. The Ferrari driver has reported the theft to local police and an investigation is underway. The incident happened when Leclerc was on a night out with his friends and trainer Andrea Ferrari.

76.title: BJP leader Jitu Chaudhary shot dead in Delhi's Mayur Vihar
76.article_body: A 42-year-old local BJP leader, identified as Jitu Chaudhary, was shot dead around 8:15 pm on Wednesday in Delhi's Mayur Vihar Phase-3. A police constable found Chaudhary's body in a pool of blood in front of his house. "A few empty cartridges and other important evidence have been recovered from the crime scene," DCP East district Priyanka Kashyap said.

77.title: Twitter user alleges kidnapping bid on train, asks Pune Police for help
77.article_body: A Twitter user asked Pune Police for help and said "a few people are trying to kidnap me," in a tweet. The user also posted a phone number in another tweet and said, "They mighty kill me, please help me." "I'm in LTT train from Bangalore," another tweet read. Police asked the user to get down at Pune Railway Station.

78.title: Akshay Kumar posts apology for ad, says 'I have not and will not endorse tobacco'
78.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has apologised for appearing in an ad for Vimal Elaichi, saying, "Your reaction over the past few days has deeply affected me...I have not and will not endorse tobacco...I step back." "I have decided to contribute the entire endorsement fee towards a worthy cause...I promise to be extremely mindful in making my future choices," he added.

79.title: Veteran Telugu filmmaker T Rama Rao passes away at the age of 84
79.article_body: Telugu filmmaker Tatineni Rama Rao passed away on Wednesday at the age of 84 at a private hospital in Chennai. The veteran filmmaker directed over 65 films in Telugu and Hindi. He made his directorial debut in 1966 with the film 'Navarathri'. Actors Ajay Devgn and Anupam Kher condoled Rao's death. He is survived by his wife and three children.

80.title: Physicist Ajay Kumar Sood appointed Principal Scientific Advisor
80.article_body: Well-known physicist Ajay Kumar Sood was appointed as the Principal Scientific Advisor (PSA) to the government, a personnel ministry order said. He has been appointed to the post for a period of three years. Ajay Kumar Sood has been a member of the Science, Technology and Innovation Advisory Council to the Prime Minister.

81.title: 4 girls drown while bathing in a canal in MP, CM condoles death
81.article_body: At least four girls studying at a residential school run by religious leader Sadhvi Ritambhara drowned in a canal in Omkareshwar area of Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the girls went to take a bath along with other classmates in the morning. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan condoled the death of the girls.

82.title: After Kumar Vishwas, Cong's Alka Lamba summoned by Punjab Police
82.article_body: Punjab Police has summoned Congress leader Alka Lamba in connection with her alleged derogatory statements against Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal before the Punjab state elections. After she received the summons, Lamba tweeted, saying she was not afraid of threats from AAP government in Punjab. This comes after former AAP leader Kumar Vishwas was booked by Punjab Police.

83.title: Chennai man arrested for carrying ganja dies in police custody
83.article_body: A 25-year-old man from Chennai who was allegedly arrested for carrying ganja and liquor illegally died in custody after a seizure attack, the police said. Police added that the deceased and 28-year-old Suresh were arrested after an auto-rickshaw they were travelling in was stopped during a routine vehicle check. According to the police, they were both history sheeters.

84.title: Inflation in Russia rises to 17.62%, highest since 2002
84.article_body: Inflation in Russia rose to 17.62% as of April 15, its highest since 2002, the Economic Development Ministry said on Wednesday. Inflation in Russia slowed to 0.2% in the week ending April 15, taking the year-to-date increase in consumer prices to 11.05%, statistics service Rosstat said. Inflation could reach between 17-20%, Russian Accounts Chamber Chairman Alexei Kudrin said last week.

85.title: Didi 'most suited' opp'n candidate for 2024 PM post: Ripun Bora
85.article_body: TMC leader Ripun Bora has said that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is the "most suitable" opposition candidate to compete against PM Narendra Modi in the 2024 General elections. "I have full respect for all the opposition leaders but considering the ground reality, I have seen Mamata Banerjee is the only one fighting aggressively against Modi," Ripun Bora added.

86.title: Gorakhpur attack accused undergoes surgery after breaking 2 bones
86.article_body: Gorakhnath temple attack accused, Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, who had broken two bones of his arms during the attack was successfully operated upon in Gorakhpur. "Two rods were inserted into his arms," Dr Rakesh Kumar of Gorakhpur Sadar Hospital said. On April 4, Abbasi forcibly tried to enter Gorakhnath temple with a sharp-edged weapon. Two constables were injured in the attack.

87.title: Video shows Russia launching missile that can 'hit any target on Earth' during test fire
87.article_body: A video shared by Russia's Ministry of Defence shows the launch of the Sarmat intercontinental ballistic missile during a test fire. "[It] was successfully launched from a silo at the Plesetsk state testing cosmodrome in Arkhangelsk Region," the tweet read. Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the missile can hit any target on Earth.

88.title: Assam boy develops theft-proof bicycle, can run 60km on single charge
88.article_body: A teenage boy, Samrat Nath, from Assam's Karimganj has developed a 'theft-proof' e-bicycle with modern sensors and it can run 60 kilometres on a single charge. It has lithium-ion batteries that were recycled from used laptops. "If anyone tries to steal my bike, a message will immediately pop up on...smartphone and theft alarm on bike will start ringing," he said.

89.title: Jahangirpuri demolition illegal, arbitrary; will burn country: Tharoor
89.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said the demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area was "illegal, arbitrary and unconstitutional". "Homes and shops were destroyed, it's an absolutely criminal act for which serious action should be taken. This is a new technique of intimidation that is going to burn our country down," Tharoor added.

90.title: DC chase down 116-run target in 63 balls, hand PBKS their 4th defeat
90.article_body: DC defeated PBKS by nine wickets at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai to jump to the sixth position on the IPL 2022 points table. PBKS were bowled out for 115 runs in 20 overs, the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far. DC chased down the 116-run target in 63 deliveries as PBKS lost their fourth match.

91.title: 'Vikram Vedha' is shaping up beautifully, it's very exciting: Neeraj
91.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' producer Neeraj Pandey has said that the film, starring Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan, is shaping up beautifully. "It's very exciting. It's one of the best scripts that we have come across," he added. Speaking about the next season of 'Special Ops', he said, "It's due next year, bigger...better. We'll go on floors by early next year."

92.title: Man Utd confirm chief scout, head of global scouting leave the club
92.article_body: Manchester United on Wednesday confirmed that the club's chief scout Jim Lawlor and head of global scouting Marcel Bout have left the club. "Jim and Marcel leave the club with our warmest thanks for their significant contribution and our very best wishes for the future," a club spokesperson said. Manchester United are currently sixth on the Premier League table.

93.title: I call producers every night to confirm 'Jersey' release date: Shahid
93.article_body: Shahid Kapoor said he calls the producers of his film 'Jersey' every night to confirm if the film's release date is still the same. "Don't think people will give me another chance," he added. 'Jersey' was slated to release on December 31, 2021, but was postponed to April 14. It was delayed again and now it'll release on April 22.

94.title: Russia to update its strategy in WTO amid 'illegal' sanctions: Putin
94.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has termed the restrictions imposed by Western states on Russian companies amid its invasion of Ukraine "illegal". Putin said the sanctions ran counter to World Trade Organization rules and they'll update Russia's strategy in the WTO by June 1. Western countries banned Russia from buying components needed to produce rolled metal and other products, Putin added.

95.title: Can hit any target, will make enemies think twice: Putin as Russia tests new missile
95.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia has successfully tested the Sarmat intercontinental ballistic missile, saying the weapon capable of carrying nuclear charges will make enemies "think twice". Dubbed Satan 2 by Western analysts, it's among Russia's next-generation missiles that Putin has called "invincible". Weighing more than 200 tonnes, Putin said it can hit any target on Earth.

96.title: Indian SaaS funding to rise 55% to $6.5 billion in 2022: Report
96.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) companies in India are expected to raise as much as $6.5 billion in 2022, a 55% increase from 2021, a report by investment firm Chiratae Ventures and management consultancy firm Zinnov revealed. The report added that some eight to 12 more SaaS companies are expected to turn unicorns this year. Currently, India has 17 SaaS unicorns.

97.title: 'Non-compete' clause in offer letter won't limit career growth: Infosys after backlash
97.article_body: Infosys, facing backlash for its 'non-compete' clause in offer letters to the employees, on Wednesday said that it won't limit the employees' career growth. The agreement reportedly says that an employee shall not accept an employment offer from "named competitors" for six months after they quit Infosys. The company reportedly named TCS, Wipro, and other major IT firms as competitors.

98.title: Fulham beat Preston to secure promotion back to Premier League
98.article_body: Fulham on Tuesday beat Preston North End 3-0 to secure promotion back to the Premier League after being relegated from the top flight of English football last year. Fulham currently have 86 points from 42 games which guarantees a top-two finish in the second-tier Championship. Fulham's Aleksandar Mitrovic scored twice in the game taking his overall tally to 40 goals.

99.title: He is a brilliant driver: Mercedes boss Wolff on Red Bull's Verstappen
99.article_body: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff said Red Bull's Max Verstappen is "a brilliant driver" adding he has a lot of respect for the "mature and intelligent" F1 world champion. "Max performed strongly all last year and he missed out on a lot of points," Wolff said. "I have a lot of respect for him and for his father, Jos," he added.

100.title: Punjab being used to increase AAP's footprint in other states: Cong
100.article_body: Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa on Wednesday said Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is using Punjab's resources, security and bureaucracy to leave "imprints in Haryana, Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh". He added that AAP MP Raghav Chadha takes calls on posting of IAS and IPS officers in Punjab. All of AAP's pre-poll promises are being tweaked, he added.

101.title: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard retires from international cricket aged 34
101.article_body: West Indies limited-overs captain Kieron Pollard today announced his retirement from international cricket at the age of 34. Pollard made his debut for West Indies in an ODI on April 10, 2007. He went on to play 123 ODIs and 101 T20Is for West Indies. He scored 4,275 runs and took 97 wickets in international cricket.

102.title: Punjab Kings record lowest total of IPL 2022 so far
102.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) recorded the lowest total of IPL 2022 so far after being dismissed for 115 in 20 overs by Delhi Capitals (DC) at Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. The previous lowest total in the ongoing edition was recorded by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) after they were bowled out for 126 runs in 18 overs against PBKS on April 3.

103.title: IFS officer shares pic of king cobra eating another cobra
103.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan has shared a picture of a king cobra eating a spectacled cobra and tweeted, "They feed on lesser mortals." "Scientific name of king cobra is: Ophiophagus hannah. 'Ophiophagus' is derived from Greek, meaning 'snake-eating' and hannah is derived from the name of tree-dwelling nymphs in Greek mythology. So king living true to its name," he added.

104.title: It felt good: Former world no. 3 Thiem on return to tennis from injury
104.article_body: Former world number three Dominic Thiem on Tuesday played his first tour-level match since last June after injuring his right wrist. Thiem lost 3-6, 6-4, 4-6 to John Millman at the Serbia Open. "Actually, I'm really happy because it was a match; it was a fight," Thiem said. The 28-year-old Austrian is currently ranked 54th in the world.

105.title: Woman cries as bulldozer demolishes her home in Delhi, Tharoor shares pic
105.article_body: A picture that has surfaced on social media shows a woman crying after a bulldozer demolishes her home during an anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Wednesday. Congress leader Shashi Tharoor shared the picture on his official Twitter handle. "Every man has become helpless...Now the political game has become very dirty," he captioned the picture.

106.title: Wimbledon bans Russian and Belarusian players from 2022 edition
106.article_body: Wimbledon banned Russian and Belarusian players from participating in the 2022 edition. "In...circumstances of such unjustified...military aggression, it'd be unacceptable for Russian regime to derive any benefits from...involvement of Russian or Belarusian players with [Wimbledon]," organisers said. "If circumstances change materially [by] June, we'll consider & respond accordingly," they added.

107.title: Brazil, Argentina to play friendly at Melbourne's MCG in June
107.article_body: The Victorian state government on Wednesday said Brazil and Argentina will play a friendly match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on June 11. "Our expectation, based on the discussions we've had, is that players like [Lionel] Messi and Neymar will be here," the state's Sports Minister Martin Pakula said. Brazil and Argentina last played at the MCG in 2017.

108.title: Truck carrying cattle seized in Assam; 5 people arrested
108.article_body: The Assam Police has rescued 35 cattle and have arrested five persons on the charges of animal cruelty in Biswanath, Assam. A team of Biswanath police station reportedly intercepted a truck from the Biswanath area, based on secret information. "We have apprehended five persons and a case has been registered in connection with it," Navin Singh, Superintendent of Police, said.

109.title: Play with Ukrainian children to make them feel welcome: Norway PM to kids
109.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Store has urged the country's children to invite Ukrainian children, who've fled their country amid Russian invasion, to play with them and make them feel welcome. "If you...[play] chess or football, invite them to join you," Store told a news briefing for media dedicated to children. About 14,000 Ukrainians have so far sought refuge in Norway.

110.title: 4 planets to align this week, to be visible with naked eye
110.article_body: Four planets, Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn, will align this week. Experts said the best viewing window is between 5 am and 6 am in the coming days. NASA had revealed that at the beginning of April, Mars, Venus and Saturn had formed a trio and now, the three planets have been joined by Jupiter.

111.title: Was crying as I hugged him: Ram on working with father in 'Acharya'
111.article_body: Ram Charan, speaking about working with his father Chiranjeevi in 'Acharya', has said, "Dad and I used to eat dinner together...then get up the next day to start working out together." While working together, Chiranjeevi reportedly told Charan that they'll be unable to relive these moments. To this, Ram said, "I was baffled. I was crying as I hugged him."

112.title: Germany rejects Russia's demand to pay for natural gas in rubles
112.article_body: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Wednesday said companies buying Russian natural gas shouldn't have to set up ruble accounts to pay for it. "Contracts are based on dollars and euros and so private-sector companies should pay in dollars or euros," Lindner said. Last month, Russian President Vladimir Putin had demanded "unfriendly countries" to pay for Russian gas in rubles.

113.title: BJP has made bulldozer a symbol of its illegal power: Akhilesh Yadav
113.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that the BJP has made bulldozers a symbol of its illegal power. "Muslims and other minorities, backward and Dalits are on their target. Now even Hindus are becoming victims of their hysteria. The BJP is actually running this bulldozer on the Constitution itself," Akhilesh added.

114.title: Netflix shares crash over 35% in their biggest fall in more than 10 years
114.article_body: Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. The stock crashed after Netflix reported losing 2,00,000 customers in Q1 2022, marking the first time in more than 10 years that the company lost subscribers. At the time of writing, Netflix shares were trading at $224.68, shedding nearly a third of their value.

115.title: FIR filed against groom 1 day after Hindu outfit stops marriage in UP
115.article_body: A day after members of the Hindu Yuva Vahini forcibly stopped an inter-faith marriage in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, police on Tuesday filed an FIR against the groom for allegedly kidnapping the bride from Ludhiana. We informed Ludhiana police as the couple belonged to different religions and the woman's family had lodged a missing complaint, Moradabad Deputy SP Sagar Jain said.

116.title: Tharoor shares meaning of word 'quockerwodger', says 'useful addition to vocabulary'
116.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday shared the meaning of the word 'quockerwodger'. "A useful addition to our political vocabulary," he wrote with the meaning. "In politics, a quockerwodger was a politician acting on the instructions of an influential third party, rather than properly representing their constituents," the meaning stated.

117.title: Take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco: Goa BJP leader to PM
117.article_body: Goa BJP leader Shekhar Salkar has requested PM Narendra Modi to take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco products. "I have no words to condemn the way Akshay Kumar has joined the gang of Amitabh Bachchan, Shahrukh Khan, Ajay Devgn to promote cancer through a surrogate advertisement of tobacco product," he said. He added these actors should be ashamed.

118.title: Haven't consciously stayed away from Bollywood: Nimrat Kaur
118.article_body: Nimrat Kaur said she has not stayed away from Bollywood consciously. "I genuinely wanted to work on more projects," she added. Nimrat said that she went to shoot for an American TV show 'Wayward Pines' after completing the 2016 film 'Airlift'. After 'Airlift', Nimrat starred in 'Dasvi'. In 2017, she featured in the Hindi web series 'The Test Case'.

119.title: Delhi sees over 1,000 new COVID-19 cases, 60% jump in single day
119.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,009 fresh cases of COVID-19, which is around 60% higher than 632 cases the city recorded on Tuesday. One person died of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate rose to 5.70% from 4.42%. The number of active cases in the national capital jumped to 2,641 from 1,274 on Tuesday.

120.title: Tata Steel to stop business with Russia over Ukraine invasion
120.article_body: Tata Steel has taken a "conscious" decision to stop doing business with Russia, the steel major said on Wednesday amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It stated, "Tata Steel doesn't have any operations or employees in Russia." All of the company's manufacturing sites in India, the UK and the Netherlands have sourced alternative supplies of raw materials, it added.

121.title: Biliti to set up world's largest electric 3-wheeler plant in T'gana
121.article_body: US-based Biliti Electric will invest $150 million to set up the world's largest electric three-wheeler production facility in Telangana, the company said in a statement. The facility, set up over a 200-acre area, will have a production capacity of 2,40,000 vehicles/year. The facility's first phase, with production capacity of 18,000 vehicles/year, is expected to be operational in early 2023.

122.title: Adani to invest ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal, to create 25,000 jobs
122.article_body: Adani Group Chairman and Founder Gautam Adani has announced that the company will invest around ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal in the next few years. "This will provide direct and indirect employment to around 25,000 people," Adani stated. He added that the investment will be made in sectors like under-sea cable, data centre and warehouses.

123.title: Bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not Arjun; punishment for Muslims: Owaisi
123.article_body: President of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that the bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not on Arjun, adding that "collective punishment" is being given to Muslims. He also asked why only shops in front of the mosques were demolished and not ones in front of the temples. "This is a targeted demolition," Owaisi added.

124.title: Butterfly-shaped house with no walls goes on sale for ₹52cr in Greece; pics surface
124.article_body: A house designed in the shape of a butterfly is up for sale on the coastline of Greece for £5.2 million (around ₹52 crore). The 5,381-sqft house has no walls and is said to have four bedrooms, four bathrooms, and an indoor pool among other luxury amenities. Viewed from above, the house emulates two wings and body of a butterfly.

125.title: Treat Briton, who was captured in Ukraine, with care: UK PM to Russia
125.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson urged Russia to treat a Briton, who was captured in Ukraine, humanely and compassionately. PM Johnson said, "I understand that he had been serving in the Ukrainian forces for some time and his situation was very different from that of a mercenary." "I hope that he's treated with care and compassion," the UK PM added.

126.title: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Delhi Files' faces objection from Sikh group, director reacts
126.article_body: Filmmakers should "desist from disturbing...uneasy calm in society", the Maharashtra Sikh Association said after Vivek Agnihotri announced his next movie 'The Delhi Files'. "I'm an Indian, I live in a sovereign state...I'll make what I need to make...I'm not a servant to anybody's demands," Agnihotri said. There has been speculation that 1984 anti-Sikh riots will feature in the film.

127.title: Microsoft India to help SaaS startups build core AI models
127.article_body: Microsoft on Wednesday announced two new initiatives to "strengthen" support for startups in India. As per the announcement, Microsoft AI Innovate will introduce its second cohort, which will let SaaS (Software as a Service) startups partner with Microsoft's engineering and product teams to build their core AI models. A hackathon aiming to create digital solutions will also be organised.

128.title: Nissan to discontinue Datsun brand in India
128.article_body: Nissan is discontinuing Datsun brand in India, the company said on Wednesday. India was one of the last markets where Datsun was still operational after its global relaunch failed and it was discontinued in Russia and Indonesia in 2020. "Datsun redi-GO production has ceased at the Chennai plant...sales of the model still continue (till the stock lasts)," Nissan India said.

129.title: India to provide additional $500 million to Sri Lanka to buy fuel
129.article_body: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister GL Peiris on Wednesday said India will provide an additional $500 million in financial assistance to the country for it to buy fuel. Previously, India sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, taking the total supply of various types of fuels under Indian assistance to Sri Lanka to 2,70,000 MT.

130.title: Bulldoze BJP HQ to stop hooliganism in country: Manish Sisodia
130.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that the BJP headquarters should be bulldozed to stop hooliganism in the country. "The illegal constructions have been demolished, now the homes of those BJP netas should be demolished who gave protection to them," Sisodia said. BJP has only encouraged fighting and has done nothing for schools and hospitals, he added.

131.title: Target not breached 'so badly': FM on 17-month-high inflation
131.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India hasn't breached the inflation target "so badly". Her statement came after India's retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of about 6.95% in March against 6.07% in February. "Our tolerance band is just 4%, plus or minus 2%...So we might go as much as 6%," she stated during her US visit.

132.title: UK PM Johnson to begin 2-day India visit tomorrow, to meet PM Modi
132.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is scheduled to begin his two-day visit to India tomorrow. He will visit Gujarat on April 21 and hold consultations with PM Narendra Modi on April 22. On Sunday, Boris had said, "My visit to India will deliver on...things that...matter to the people of both...nations...from job creation and economic growth to energy security and defence."

133.title: Bomb blast hits crowded restaurant in Nigeria; 3 killed, 19 injured
133.article_body: At least three people were killed and 19 others injured in a blast in east Nigeria's Taraba state on Tuesday, reports stated. The incident reportedly took place at a crowded restaurant located in Irawe town of Taraba, a police spokesperson was quoted as saying. "It's suspected to have been caused by an improvised explosive device that detonated," the spokesperson added.

134.title: DC to bowl first against PBKS, Sarfaraz Khan replaces COVID-19 +ve Mitchell Marsh
134.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. DC have made one change to their playing XI, with Sarfaraz Khan replacing Mitchell Marsh, who recently tested positive for COVID-19. Meanwhile, Nathan Ellis replaced Odean Smith in PBKS' playing XI.

135.title: Farah shares old pic of Abhishek, Hrithik from her sangeet; fans react
135.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan shared an old picture of actors Abhishek Bachchan and Hrithik Roshan from her sangeet function on Instagram. "Found an almost vintage pic of these two boys...Abhishek and Hrithik dancing up a storm. Can't remember to which song. I was too drunk," Farah captioned the post. "One of the best duos, best cop and thief," a user commented.

136.title: Did 80 shows in 2019, missed playing live during pandemic: Prateek Kuhad
136.article_body: Singer Prateek Kuhad has revealed that he did around 80 live shows while touring in 2019. "I was exhausted by the end of 2019...I did feel a sense of relief [when the lockdown happened] because I didn't have to play shows," he stated. Prateek added that he started missing the stage and playing live after a year into the pandemic.

137.title: Gang of fake Microsoft workers busted in Gurugram, 3 women among 14 held
137.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Wednesday busted a gang of fake Microsoft workers and arrested 14 people, including three women, for cheating US nationals by sending pop-ups on their computer screens. The police raided the call centre in Gurugram and seized 14 laptops, nine mobile phones and over ₹1.10 lakh in cash, reports said.

138.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi's Ghazipur landfill site for 3rd time since Mar 28
138.article_body: Another fire broke out at the Ghazipur landfill site in east Delhi on Wednesday, nearly 10 days after a massive fire broke out at the same site. A total of nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot to bring the blaze under control. This is the third fire incident at the landfill site since March 28.

139.title: Did a line or two of cocaine with Amber Heard's sister, admits Johnny Depp in court
139.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp, during a defamation trial, admitted to doing "a line or two" of cocaine with his ex-wife Amber Heard's sister, Whitney. He said Heard's allegations of substance abuse have been "grossly embellished" and that there have been no moments where he's been out of control. "I'm not some maniac who needs to be high...all the time," Depp stated.

140.title: Don't think this is COVID 4th wave: Ex-ICMR scientist as cases rise
140.article_body: Former head scientist at ICMR, Dr Raman R Gangakhedkar, on Wednesday said he doesn't think that a fourth wave of COVID-19 has emerged in the country. "No new variant has emerged so far," he said. He added that those who are older and people who haven't taken vaccines need to remember to use a face mask.

141.title: People have lost faith in WB police: BJP's Anirban Ganguly
141.article_body: Amid political violence in West Bengal, BJP's Anirban Ganguly has said that the people of West Bengal have lost faith in the state police. Demanding CBI investigation in the recent rape cases, he said, "The SIT is never successful in the investigations because TMC is pressurising them to not do the investigation properly."

142.title: Gujarat Police registered 12,500 cyber crime complaints in March
142.article_body: Gujarat Police's cybercrime cell received around 12,500 complaints related to financial fraud, stalking or bullying and other cybercrimes in March. "Among the 12,488 complaints registered in March this year, around 3,338 were recognised as financial frauds to the tune of ₹3.09 crore," a statement said. The cell also froze ₹1.20 crore in bank accounts and refunded ₹51.12 lakh.

143.title: Man who shot Khargone SP during riots identified: MP Home Minister
143.article_body: The man who fired a bullet at Khargone SP Siddharth Choudhary during the riots on Ram Navami on April 10 has been identified and will be arrested soon, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. "Those who indulged in the stone-pelting during the communal violence are being identified through video footage," Narottam Mishra added.

144.title: Delhi man's juice shop bulldozed, video shows him saying 'I had all papers'
144.article_body: A juice shop of a man named Ganesh Kumar Gupta was bulldozed in a demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Wednesday. In a video, the man can be heard saying, "I...said that Supreme Court has halted the demolition one hour ago, but they did not stop." He added, "I told them I have all...papers. But they didn't listen."

145.title: 'Article 15' is the only dark film I've done, it affected me: Ayushmann
145.article_body: After completing 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that 'Article 15' was the film that really affected him. "That's the only dark film I've done. The theme was very dark," he stated. "I had read a lot about BR Ambedkar and also casteism...that affected me," he further added. The film was directed by Anubhav Sinha.

146.title: Israel announces end to indoor mask-mandate for 2nd time
146.article_body: Israel on Wednesday said for the second-time that citizens no longer have to wear masks indoors, after briefly dropping the requirement for two weeks last June before cases surged. A government statement said the mask mandate will be removed from Saturday after approval from a parliamentary oversight committee. Israel's health ministry said about 64% of the population are considered vaccinated.

147.title: Durban floods kill at least 448 as $67 million allocated in relief
147.article_body: South Africa has allocated $67 million in relief for those affected by the floods in Durban, and the surrounding KwaZulu-Natal province, that have killed at least 448 people so far. Officials on Tuesday said over 40,000 people have been displaced as nearly 4,000 homes have been destroyed while over 40 people remain missing.

148.title: Wearing of face masks indoors no longer obligatory: Spanish govt
148.article_body: The Spanish government on Tuesday said wearing face masks indoors is no longer obligatory. However, masks remain mandatory on all forms of public transport but not in stations and airports. Over 92% of the population aged 12 and older is fully vaccinated. Masks became mandatory for use indoors and outdoors in Spain in early 2020.

149.title: Covid-19 situation in Maharashtra is under control: Rajesh Tope
149.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said that the Covid-19 situation in the state is under control and people need not panic. "Yesterday, there were 137 cases in Maharashtra, including 85 in Mumbai. The state had earlier seen 60,000 cases a day. So, the present situation is under control and there is no need to panic," Tope said.

150.title: Ban RSS, Bajrang Dal and VHP along with PFI: K'taka Cong leader
150.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader MB Patil called for a ban on RSS, Bajrang Dal, Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), along with Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI). "Ban AIMIM also, we don't have any reservations, let it get cleared at once, by doing so showcase your (BJP-led government's) strong will...Congress party will fully support," Patil said.

151.title: Vivek Agnihotri's Kashmir Files to release in Israel on April 28
151.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files', which was directed by Vivek Agnihotri, will release in Israel on April 28 with Hebrew subtitles. "I thank Consul General Kobbi Shoshani for coming to our studio to inaugurate the poster of 'The Kashmir Files'," Vivek tweeted. "It is a major step in sharing our [common] goal of fighting terrorism and promoting humanity," he added.

152.title: No 4th wave of Covid-19 in the state now: K'taka health minister
152.article_body: Amid concerns of another possible wave of Covid-19, Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar said that Karnataka is not facing the fourth wave of Covid-19 now. He ensured that the government was taking all the precautionary measures and monitoring rise in cases. "We are in contact with other states as well and are gathering all the required information," he said.

153.title: Hyd Police busts cricket betting racket, seize ₹1.2 lakh
153.article_body: Members of the Commissioner's Task Force, South Zone Team and Hyderabad's Falaknuma Police busted a cricket betting racket on Tuesday and seized cash worth ₹1.2 lakh and two mobile phones. The accused were allegedly betting on the IPL match between Royal Challengers Bangalore and Lucknow Super Giants when the police apprehended them. The prime accused is a native of Falaknuma.

154.title: Pics of Johnny Depp's injuries allegedly caused by Amber Heard shown in court
154.article_body: Johnny Depp's personal security guard, Sean Bett, shared pictures of the injured actor during the ongoing defamation trial between Depp and his ex-wife Amber Heard. Sean said he took the photos as "evidence", claiming to have been present after two attacks by Heard. He said the first incident happened in March 2015 and the second incident was in December 2015.

155.title: Demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri wasn't confined to rioters: Mayor
155.article_body: The demolition of alleged illegal encroachments in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Wednesday wasn't confined to those accused of riots during a Hanuman Jayanti rally last week, North Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor Raja Iqbal Singh has said. He added that it is routine work with no agenda. "The roads will be cleared and people are happy...people are supporting us," he added.

156.title: 'World's loneliest house' on a deserted island goes on sale for ₹2.5cr in US; pic viral
156.article_body: A house dubbed as the 'world's loneliest home' on a deserted island in the US' Maine has gone up for sale for around $339,000 (around ₹2.5 crore). Built in 2009, the 540-sqft house has just one bedroom, one bathroom and an outhouse on the porch. It is located on Duck Ledges Island.

157.title: Electricity dept employee kicked on chest over power cut in Hyd, video viral
157.article_body: A sub-engineer of the electricity department in Hyderabad's Karwan section office was kicked on his chest by a man after electricity supply to his office was cut over long pending issues, police said. A video that has gone viral on social media shows the 22-year-old man thrashing the junior engineer at his office. Other people tried to stop the man.

158.title: Work to destroy peace in state has begun: Maha Home Minister
158.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Wednesday said that in the last few days the work to destroy peace has started in the state and the police are on alert mode. "After what happened in Delhi, we have inputs to spoil the atmosphere in Maharashtra, we've ordered police to be on alert mode," he said.

159.title: Delhi schools to continue in offline mode, separate SOP soon: Officials
159.article_body: Schools in Delhi will continue in offline mode while ensuring that COVID-19 protocols are strictly followed, officials said on Wednesday. "Schools have been asked to report all cases to the education department," a senior official said. The Delhi Disaster Management Authority has also decided to come up with a separate Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for schools after consulting experts.

160.title: Another DC foreign player tests COVID-19 positive ahead of tonight's match against PBKS
160.article_body: A second foreign player from Delhi Capitals squad tested positive for COVID-19 after a Rapid Antigen Test was conducted on Wednesday, the sixth such case in the camp. The BCCI will conduct another round of testing before Delhi Capitals' match against Punjab Kings, which is scheduled to begin at 7.30 pm. The match was earlier moved from Pune to Mumbai.

161.title: Was once told to leave an audition before giving my shot: Ayushmann
161.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana recalled auditioning for a role 11-12 years ago and said the audition was being held in front of other aspiring actors. "They were like 'read your lines'. I told them 'everybody will see, they'll take my ideas'," Ayushmann said. The actor asked if he could audition when everyone was gone. "They said 'no, please leave'," he added.

162.title: People were not ready for women-led films like 'Angry...': Pavleen
162.article_body: Discussing her film 'Angry Indian Goddesses' which released in 2015, actress Pavleen Gujral said people were not ready for women-led films at that stage, adding that the movie was "out of the ordinary". Pavleen stated that she did not act for three years after the film released. "Now it's...more about characters than who is playing the character," said Pavleen.

163.title: BrahMos supersonic missile creates hole in abandoned Indian ship; pic surfaces
163.article_body: A BrahMos supersonic cruise missile was successfully test fired from the Indian Navy warship INS Delhi on Tuesday, the Indian Navy said. "The missile without warhead created a hole in the abandoned ship. The missile travels at a speed of around 3,000 kmph and is difficult to intercept by air defence systems," BrahMos officials said.

164.title: Musk leaves a blank space in his latest tweet, users link it to buying Twitter
164.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted, "_______ is the Night," which Twitter users and reports linked to his plan of buying Twitter. It fuelled speculations that he'd launch a tender offer for Twitter shares if the board resists his proposal to acquire Twitter. "The missing word may be 'Tender' as per the F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel, or it could be 'Tonight'," Bloomberg reported.

165.title: Rahul sowing seeds of hatred, maligning country's image: BJP leader
165.article_body: BJP leader and Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that Rahul Gandhi is sowing seeds of hatred and maligning the country's image. "This is all you can expect from someone whose history is linked to corruption and riots," Thakur said. Gandhi had previously criticised the government for their use of bulldozers in violence-hit areas in Delhi and Madhya Pradesh.

166.title: 4 people killed, several injured in coal mine blasts in Poland
166.article_body: At least four people were killed and 20 others were injured in suspected methane blasts in a coal mine in Poland on Wednesday. According to mining company JSW, the explosions occurred at Pniowek mine in Pawlowice shortly after midnight at a depth of 1,000 meters. Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki expressed his condolences to the families of injured and deceased persons.

167.title: Over the moon with the reactions to 'Jayeshbhai...' trailer: Ranveer
167.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that he is "really over the moon" with the reactions to the trailer of his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. "The reactions have actually exceeded my personal expectations which has left me surprised and I'm..happy about that," he added. Adding that his film is an entertainer, Ranveer said that the film has a social message.

168.title: Over 5 million people left Ukraine amid Russian invasion
168.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) said that over five million people have fled Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. The conflict has displaced over 7 million people within Ukraine and around 13 million people are believed to be trapped in the war-affected areas, UNHCR added. It's the biggest refugee crisis in Europe since World War II.

169.title: Delhi likely to see light rain, thundershowers on Wednesday night
169.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted cloudy sky with light rainfall or thundershowers in Delhi on Wednesday night. The city is likely to receive light rainfall on Thursday as well. The maximum temperature in the national capital is likely to settle at around 41°C and the minimum temperature may be around 24°C on Wednesday.

170.title: Mudrex announces it is world's largest crypto index investing platform
170.article_body: Mudrex announced that it became the world's largest crypto index investing platform after its user base saw a 2400% increase in first quarter of 2022. Indian users contributed an increase of over 80% to this growth, the company added. Mudrex recently introduced SIPs to automate investments in Mudrex Coin Sets, which are baskets of cryptocurrencies based on a particular theme.

171.title: German Foreign Minister Baerbock visits Baltic nations on 3-day trip
171.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Wednesday began her three-day trip to the Baltic nations of Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia. All three countries are members of the EU and NATO. "If necessary, we will defend every square centimetre of territory of our joint alliance," Baerbock said. She is set to meet with each nation's leader in their respective capitals.

172.title: We're facing our last days: Ukrainian commander in Mariupol asks for help
172.article_body: A commander for the Ukrainian marines fighting Russian forces in Mariupol said his troops are "outnumbered" and are facing their "last days, if not hours". Serhiy Volyna urged the world leaders to help evacuate more than 500 wounded soldiers and hundreds of women and children he said were hiding with them at a steel plant in the besieged city.

173.title: LinkedIn most imitated brand for phishing in Q1 2022: Check Point
173.article_body: As per a report by Check Point Research (CPR), LinkedIn, for the first time ever, has become the most often imitated brand by cyber criminals for phishing. CPR stated that LinkedIn accounted for 52% of all phishing attempts during Q1 2022. It was followed by DHL (14%), Google (7%), Microsoft (6%), FedEx (6%), WhatsApp (4%) and Amazon (2%).

174.title: Video shows man holding gun while dancing with dancer in Bihar; IAS officer reacts
174.article_body: A video showing a man with a gun in his hand while dancing with a female dancer in Bihar's Gopalganj has surfaced online. The man can also be seen pointing the gun at her. Reacting to the video on Twitter, IAS officer Sanjay Kumar said, "This makes me speechless and also makes me realise the level of 'cultural depravity'."

175.title: Swiss authorities approve 1st cannabis sale pilot project in summer
175.article_body: Swiss health authorities on Tuesday approved a pilot project for the sale and recreational consumption of cannabis in Basel this summer. The city's government said about 400 people will be allowed to purchase cannabis from select pharmacies later this summer. The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health said the aim is to test whether cannabis consumption changes when legally bought.

176.title: Excess weight can nearly double the risk of womb cancer: Study
176.article_body: According to research, lifelong excess weight in women can be linked to womb cancer. The study states for every 5 extra BMI units, a woman's risk of developing womb cancer is almost doubled. Researchers studied 14 traits that linked obesity to womb cancer and found two hormones - fasting insulin and testosterone that increased risk of developing cancer in participants.
