177.title: Bacteria in urine may signal aggressive forms of prostate cancer: Study
177.article_body: Researchers have found five types of bacteria, namely, Anaerococcus, Peptoniphilus, Porphyromonas, Fenollaria and Fusobacterium in urine and tissue samples of 600 men with or without prostate cancer. Detection of any of these specific anaerobic bacteria in the participants hinted at the presence of higher grades of prostate cancer and more rapid progression to aggressive disease, researchers said.

178.title: BJP's Narasimha Rao calls JCB 'Jihad Control Board' in tweet, deletes later
178.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP GVL Narasimha Rao took to Twitter to call JCB 'Jihad Control Board'. However, he later deleted the tweet. His tweet came after Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) began an anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri, where violence had taken place after clashes erupted between groups during a Hanuman Jayanti procession.

179.title: TN to create corpus of Tamil words for terms used in various sectors
179.article_body: Tamil Nadu government would create a corpus of Tamil words for terms to be used in various sectors, including medical, engineering and technology, Minister for Tamil Official Language and Tamil Culture, Thangam Thenarasu said. According to him, ₹35 lakh would be allocated for the same. He added that ₹5.36 crore would be allocated for competitions in Tamil-related subjects every year.

180.title: Tag of Bulbul from 'Kumkum...' will always be with me; I take pride in it: Mrunal
180.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, who made a shift to films after featuring in the television show 'Kumkum Bhagya' as 'Bulbul', said that the small screen taught her professionalism. "The tag of Bulbul will stay with me forever. I take immense pride that I started with television," she added. Mrunal said television was her grooming process where she learned the technical process.

181.title: Yami recalls auditioning for 'Vicky Donor' after film completes 10 yrs
181.article_body: Yami Gautam, taking to Instagram, shared a picture from the studio where she auditioned for the 2012 film 'Vicky Donor'. "The place where it all began! Started my journey auditioning for 'Vicky Donor' right here," she wrote. The film completed 10 years of its release on Wednesday. "Recent visit to this studio took me down the memory lane," Yami added.

182.title: Canada to keep mask mandate on for public transport: Minister
182.article_body: Canada has decided to continue the mask mandate for people while using public transportation for the foreseeable future. "Masks are proving to provide additional layers of protection," said Canadian Transportation Minister Omar Alghabra. "[The] regulation is in place and is based on the advice we receive from our experts," he added. His remarks came after US dropped the mask mandate.

183.title: Uber, Lyft drop face mask mandate for riders, drivers in US
183.article_body: Ride-hailing companies Uber and Lyft on Tuesday announced they are ending their face mask mandates for both riders and drivers in the US. A federal judge on Monday ruled that the government mandate was unlawful, removing its enforcement on public transportation in the country. Uber introduced a face mask mandate for its delivery workers, riders and drivers in May 2020.

184.title: UP govt planning to develop Ayodhya as 'Climate-Smart City'
184.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is planning to develop Ayodhya as a 'Climate-Smart City' focusing on renewable energy. According to a government spokesperson, a 1,200-acre wide Greenfield township has been proposed to meet the demand of people looking forward to staying in a self-sustainable township. Further, the CM has also ordered officials to speed up the development of the holy city.

185.title: I might have to get umpire a beer after that: Hazlewood on Stoinis wide-ball incident
185.article_body: Referring to umpire Chris Gaffaney not calling his delivery to LSG's Marcus Stoinis a 'wide' in 19th over despite it moving beyond the tram line, RCB fast bowler Josh Hazlewood said, "I got pretty lucky on that one." He added, "I might have to get umpire a beer after that." Hazlewood went on to dismiss Stoinis on the next ball.

186.title: Wasim Jaffer shares meme to describe Virat Kohli's 'luck' while batting
186.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a meme to describe Virat Kohli's 'luck' while batting. Kohli has scored 119 runs in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.83. His strike rate in the ongoing tournament is 123.96. Kohli was dismissed for golden duck against LSG on Tuesday. Kohli has been run-out twice in IPL 2022.

187.title: BJP working as carrier of Hindutva: Devendra Fadnavis
187.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that the Hindutva concept is an intricate part of Indian DNA and the BJP is working as the carrier of Hindutva. Fadnavis added, "Hindutva is a concept that is not based on pooja or karma. Hindutva is a concept that is geographically connected with India," Fadnavis added.

188.title: 2 bike-borne men rob money transfer firm employees of ₹10.9 lakh in Ludhiana
188.article_body: Two bike-borne men took away ₹10.9 lakh from two employees of a money transfer firm after threatening them with a gun near Ludhiana’s grain market on Gill Road on Tuesday. While the victims were returning to the office on a bike after collecting the amount, the robbers waylaid them and executed the crime.

189.title: Mika got offended as Shoojit called him 'Mickey' during 'Vicky..': Ayushmann
189.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that singer Mika Singh got offended after filmmaker Shoojit Sircar called him "Mickey" during shoot of 'Vicky Donor'. "I told him 'Sir his name is Mika.' He is so bad with names...He would often call me Anshuman and call Yami Yamini...Shoojit Da was so bad with names, now of course he knows our name," he added.

190.title: Kabir Singh pushed me to quit smoking; I was like 'I'm done, I can't': Shahid
190.article_body: Speaking about his lifestyle changes, Shahid Kapoor said he's disciplined when it comes to sleep now. "I used to be [an]...insomniac and I flipped that after I had...kids," he added. "I've been a smoker on and off but now for...few years, I haven't smoked. I think 'Kabir Singh'...did it for me. [I was like] 'I can't. I'm done'," he said.

191.title: YouTube blocks HK's sole leadership candidate under US sanctions
191.article_body: YouTube has blocked the account of Hong Kong's sole leadership candidate John Lee as part of US sanctions. "With regards to some [social] media [platforms] which I will have no access to, I feel disappointed but this will not affect my election effort," Lee said. Meta said it had taken steps to prevent the use of payments services by Lee.

192.title: Flagged infighting, but Congress didn’t act: Ripun Bora after joining TMC
192.article_body: Former Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora, who recently joined Trinamool Congress, said that he always alerted the party high command about the "corrosive effects of infighting, but no action was taken". "Some of my senior colleagues kept demanding my removal. When they couldn't replace me, they did everything to not let me become the CM," he said during an interview.

193.title: Situation returning to normalcy in Delhi's Jahangirpuri: Police
193.article_body: The situation in Delhi's Jahangirpuri is heading towards normalcy amid heavy deployment of security personnel in the violence-hit area, police said on Tuesday. Over 500 police personnel and six companies of additional force have been deployed in the area, reports said. Some shops, mainly for groceries, have opened and the movement of people is becoming normal, police said.

194.title: Elephant, which killed 5 people, found dead in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband
194.article_body: A female elephant, that killed five people earlier this month, was found dead in the Gariaband district of Chhattisgarh. The 35-year-old animal's carcass was found in the submergence area of Sikaser dam in Dhawalpur forest range on Tuesday, Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) Mayank Agrawal said. According to Agrawal, a preliminary investigation found inflammation in the elephant's buccal cavity.

195.title: Lakhs of people face power outages in US caused by snowstorm
195.article_body: Lakhs of people reportedly faced power outages in various states across the US owing to a snowstorm. The outages were reported in New York, Pennsylvania, Maine, New Hampshire and Vermont. In New York state alone, over 1.95 lakh people faced power cuts. The state government said the snowstorm brought down trees and disrupted power lines.

196.title: Boney Kapoor to launch daughter Anshula Kapoor in Bollywood: Reports
196.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor will reportedly launch her daughter Anshula Kapoor in Bollywood. According to reports, since Boney is also acting in a film, he feels if Anshula too joins films as an actor, the Kapoors will become a 5-star family, including him and his kids. Reports added he has seen Anshula in school plays and vouches for her acting talent.

197.title: Discrimination: KTR on govt's decision to move GCTM to Guj from Hyd
197.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said that the Centre's decision to move WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine (GCTM) to Gujarat from Hyderabad is discrimination against Telangana. KTR tweeted, "The saga of PM Narendra Modi Ji's discrimination against Telangana goes on unabated." Notably, PM Modi on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for WHO GCTM at Jamnagar in Gujarat.

198.title: We don't divide people, we stay like family: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
198.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that in Bengal we don't divide people on the basis of caste, creed or religion, "we stay like family". "Irrespective of one being from any part of the country, whenever one's in Bengal, one's part of our family and should be comfortable here," Banerjee further said while addressing Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata.

199.title: Blackstone, Vista rule out financing Musk's $43 bn Twitter bid: Report
199.article_body: Private equity firms Blackstone and Vista Equity Partners have ruled out financing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy Twitter, Bloomberg reported. Brookfield Asset Management has also decided not to finance the bid. Blackstone and Vista have decided not to finance any potential bid for Twitter, even if it's from another party besides Musk, at the moment.

200.title: Never seen him struggle like this: Pietersen on Kohli's golden duck
200.article_body: Reacting to RCB batter Virat Kohli's golden duck against LSG which marked 100 professional matches for Kohli without scoring a ton, ex-RCB captain Kevin Pietersen said he has "never seen" Kohli struggle like this. Kohli has scored 119 runs in seven IPL 2022 matches so far. He is currently ranked 34th in IPL 2022's list of leading run-getters.

201.title: Jio loses mobile subscribers for 3rd straight month; Airtel gains
201.article_body: Reliance Jio lost 36.6 lakh mobile subscribers in February, the first time that it has lost subscribers for the third consecutive month, data by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) showed. Meanwhile, Bharti Airtel, the only telco to gain subscribers in February, added 15.91 lakh new customers. Vodafone Idea lost 15.32 lakh users while BSNL lost 1.11 lakh customers.

202.title: We're looking for collective effort to get off the mark: MI's Unadkat
202.article_body: MI pacer Jaydev Unadkat has said they're not looking too far ahead and focusing on putting a "collective" effort to first get off the mark. He added, "There's no point in looking at the bigger picture. The state we're in, we're just looking to put some things right." MI, who are winless in six games, will face CSK on Thursday.

203.title: Video shows jawan carrying pregnant woman to hospital on cot in Chhattisgarh
203.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a jawan of the District Reserve Guard force carrying a pregnant woman to a hospital on a cot in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district. The jawan was accompanied by some locals. The woman and her newborn baby are in good health, Inspector General of Police in  Bastar Range Sundarraj Pattilingam said.

204.title: Which states have the highest active COVID-19 cases as India reports jump in cases?
204.article_body: With India reporting 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, the data released by the Health Ministry showed that there are 12,340 active coronavirus cases in India. Kerala has the highest number of active cases with 2,432 cases. This is followed by 1,947 active cases in Delhi, 1,529 in Karnataka, 1,351 in Assam and 1,125 in Haryana.

205.title: RCB require such a bowler to win IPL: Kaif on Hazlewood's 4-wicket haul
205.article_body: Reacting to RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood's four-wicket haul against LSG, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said RCB require such a bowler to win the IPL. "The first spell he bowled with the new ball, you will spend money to watch a spell like that," added Kaif. "Hazlewood always reminds us [of ex-Australian pacer] Glenn McGrath," stated ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan.

206.title: Bulldoze BJP HQ, Amit Shah's house to stop riots: Raghav Chadha
206.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said communal riots in India will stop if BJP headquarters and Home Minister Amit Shah's house are bulldozed. "BJP rehabilitated Rohingyas and people from Bangladesh in large numbers so that they can help the party in orchestrating these riots...Ask BJP where these people have been rehabilitated to know where future riots will take place," Chadha added.

207.title: Prashant Kishor has become brand in country: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot
207.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor has become a brand in the country, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said. "In 2014, he was with PM Narendra Modi, then with (Bihar CM) Nitish Kumar and then with Congress in Punjab and many others," Gehlot added. "We also take advice from experts and agencies. His experience might be useful in uniting the Opposition," Gehlot stated.

208.title: Demolition drive in Jahangirpuri unconstitutional: CPI(M)'s Brinda
208.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat on Wednesday termed the demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri unconstitutional. She said, "The law and the Constitution have been bulldozed by carrying out illegal demolitions." After the drive was stopped, Brinda appealed to the people of Jahangirpuri to maintain peace and harmony and wait for Supreme Court's next order.

209.title: Made sure she is protected: Prince Harry after meeting Queen Elizabeth
209.article_body: UK's Prince Harry said he made sure that his grandmother Queen Elizabeth II had the "right people around her" and was "protected" when he met the British monarch last week. Harry and his wife Meghan met the Queen at Windsor Castle on their first trip to Britain since quitting royal duties in 2020. It was "great" meeting her, Harry added.

210.title: Auditioned in 2017, got call after 2 yrs; was hard to recall project: RRR star
210.article_body: 'RRR' actress Ahmareen Anjum said that she auditioned for the role of Loki in 2017 and forgot about it after that. "Two years later, I got a call that I have been shortlisted, it was hard to recall which project exactly...The moment I realised...that I have been finalised for such a strong character...I felt extremely happy and grateful," she added.

211.title: B'wood has forgotten heroism; films like RRR, KGF have created havoc: Sanjay
211.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said "heroism" in Bollywood has been sidelined in favour of slice-of-life movies. "Why have we forgotten heroism in our industry? The South...always believed in heroism...South films like 'RRR', 'Pushpa' or...'KGF'...are creating havoc all over India," he said. "Why are we forgetting Bihar, UP, Jharkhand...This is 90% of our audience, they're hungry to see our movies," he added.

212.title: Luck hasn't favoured Kohli so far but it's time to deliver: Jaffer
212.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said luck hasn't favoured RCB batter Virat Kohli so far in IPL 2022, but he has to now deliver with the business end of the tournament approaching. Kohli was dismissed for a golden duck in RCB's last match against LSG. It marked Kohli's fourth IPL golden duck and his first golden duck in IPL since 2017.

213.title: Netherlands head coach Ryan Campbell out of induced coma, still in ICU
213.article_body: Netherlands head coach and ex-Australia wicketkeeper Ryan Campbell has come out of the induced coma but still remains in the ICU after he suffered a heart attack last week in the UK. The 50-year-old was at a playground with his children when he collapsed. "They've taken the heavy sedation off, so he's actually woken up," said Campbell's brother Mark.

214.title: Ethereum network has many single points of failure: Twitter's Dorsey
214.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in his response to a tweet stated that the Ethereum network "has many single points of failure" and the projects built on it are "not interesting" to him. This comes after Ethereum Co-founder, Vitalik Buterin, commented on Elon Musk's Twitter bid saying he opposes wealthy people or organisations' "hostile" take over of social media firms.

215.title: GB Nagar Police serve over 900 notices for violation of loudspeaker ban
215.article_body: Around 900 religious places have been served notices for violating the loudspeaker ban in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar, police said on Wednesday. This includes 602 temples, 265  mosques, 16 other religious places, 217 procession houses and 175 DJ operators. "If any religious place, DJ operator does not follow the instructions...strict action will be taken against them," the notice read.

216.title: Kerala Police arrests man from Assam for murdering wife
216.article_body: Kerala Police on Tuesday arrested a man from Assam's Nagaon for allegedly murdering his wife in their rented house on April 1, an officer said. The man and his wife, both hailing from Nagaon, had been staying in the Perumbur area where he worked, the officer added. Kerala Police traced the man to his village during the investigation.

217.title: Defence Ministry exceeds domestic procurement target of 64% in FY 2021-22
217.article_body: The Ministry of Defence (MoD) in a statement on Wednesday said that it exceeded its target of 64% meant for domestic purchases in the financial year 2021-22. The ministry said it "utilised 65.50% of capital acquisition budget on indigenous procurements through Indian Industry to achieve PM Narendra Modi's vision of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'."

218.title: UK judge orders extradition of Assange to US; will face 175-year sentence
218.article_body: A UK judge has ordered the extradition of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to the US where he will face a 175-year sentence. Assange is wanted in the US on 18 criminal charges after WikiLeaks published thousands of classified files and diplomatic cables in 2010. The decision will now move to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel.

219.title: Pleased with Rahul's dismissal as RCB have struggled against him: Hesson
219.article_body: RCB's Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said they were "very happy" after the dismissal of LSG captain KL Rahul, as RCB have struggled to dismiss Rahul in the past. "I would like to say that [Rahul's dismissal]...was a pre-planned move but it was not," added Hesson. Rahul was dismissed for 30 as RCB defeated LSG by 18 runs.

220.title: Chernobyl nuclear plant has restored ties with state regulator: IAEA
220.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said Ukraine has informed the agency that it has restored direct communications between the Chernobyl nuclear power plant and the state atomic power regulator after Russian troops left the facility. Russian forces had occupied the defunct power station soon after invading Ukraine on February 24 but left on March 31, the IAEA said.

221.title: Controlled blast at construction site damages windows of adjacent homes in Pune
221.article_body: A contractor of a residential project in Pune's Sus area has been booked after a controlled blast at the site damaged window panes of apartments at neighbouring buildings. A complainant said the explosion also damaged the windows of some of the cars. "The real estate developer has been directed to submit...necessary documents that gave him mining permission," an official said.

222.title: There may be 10 new signings: Rangnick on Man Utd's 0-4 loss vs Liverpool
222.article_body: Reacting to Manchester United's 0-4 defeat against Liverpool in a Premier League match, Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick said the club may sign 10 new players. "It's embarrassing...completely disappointing, in a way also humiliating," added Ralf. "We just have to accept that Liverpool are...six years ahead of us. They have 25 Formula One racing cars," stated Ralf.

223.title: Jupiter moon Europa could be capable of harbouring life: Study
223.article_body: A study has revealed that the similarities between Jupiter's moon Europa's surface and a landform in Greenland hint that the moon may be capable of harbouring life. Researchers studied similarities between double ridges across Europa's surface and a smaller version of it in Greenland. The refreezing of liquid subsurface water drove the formation of Greenland's double ridge.

224.title: All should condemn atrocities by TRS leaders: Telangana BJP chief
224.article_body: BJP Telangana unit President Bandi Sanjay Kumar has said that everybody should condemn the "atrocities by the TRS leaders". He further urged the party workers to hold black flag protests against the "atrocities, murders and abetment of suicides by the TRS leaders". This came after a BJP activist, Sai Ganesh, reportedly died by suicide in Telangana's Khammam on April 16.

225.title: Action taken on 'crime', not 'community': Minister on Jahangirpuri arrests
225.article_body: Responding to the action taken after violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area, Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Wednesday said that the arrests were made on the basis of "crime" not "caste and community". He further said that those trying to hide a crime behind "communal cover" want to create "fear" in society through a "caucus of criminals".

226.title: HDFC to sell 10% stake in HDFC Capital for ₹184 crore
226.article_body: HDFC on Wednesday announced that it's selling a 10% stake in its private equity arm HDFC Capital Advisors to a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) for about ₹184 crore. HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said ADIA's investment will enable HDFC Capital to leverage ADIA's global expertise. HDFC had announced its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month.

227.title: Manchester City pay tribute to 'KGF: Chapter 2' with pic, Farhan Akhtar says 'Brilliant'
227.article_body: Premier League club Manchester City posted a tribute to Kannada film 'KGF: Chapter 2' on social media on Wednesday. The team shared a picture of their players Kevin de Bruyne, Ilkay Gündogan and Phil Foden and wrote, "Our very own KGF!" Actor-producer Farhan Akhtar, who has presented the Hindi version of the film, commented on the post, "Brilliant."

228.title: Married man runs away with woman; Guj HC orders him to pay 50% of police search cost
228.article_body: Gujarat High Court has ordered a married man in Ahmedabad to pay half the amount spent by the government to trace a 20-year-old woman he ran away with last year. "We deem it appropriate to direct 50% of the said amount which shall be sum of ₹55,000," court said. The woman's father said he spent ₹8.06 lakh to trace her.

229.title: Govt favouring rioters, targeting a community: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
229.article_body: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind on Wednesday criticised the government over the demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. Its official, Niaz Ahmed Farooqui, said that by doing this following riots in the area, the government is only favouring the rioters and targeting a community. The government shouldn't do this, he added. He further said he had written to the authorities to stop the drive.

230.title: 2 newborns die at Raj govt hospital after radiant warmers get overheated
230.article_body: Two infants, who were 11 and four days old, died at government-run hospital in Rajasthan's Beawar on Monday after radiant warmers meant to keep them warm, got overheated due to voltage fluctuation after power cut. Dr KL Meena, Director of Family Welfare, said appropriate voltage for the warmer is 230 volts but it shot up to 332 volts after fluctuation.

231.title: What reasons did Netflix give for losing members for the first time in 10 years?
231.article_body: Netflix revealed that 2,00,000 people left the streaming service in the first three months of the year, marking its first fall in subscribers in more than 10 years. Netflix gave several reasons including COVID-19 disruptions, account sharing, sluggish economic growth, increasing inflation, and Russia's invasion of Ukraine for slower growth. It also cited competition from YouTube, Amazon, and Hulu.

232.title: Brinda Karat blocks bulldozer to stop demolition in Delhi, waves court papers
232.article_body: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat stood in front of a bulldozer to stop a demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Wednesday. A video shows Karat waiving court papers at the spot after the Supreme Court stayed the demolition drive. The North Delhi Municipal Corporation on Wednesday sent bulldozers to remove alleged illegal encroachments in Jahangirpuri.

233.title: 4 men trapped in 50-foot-deep sewage tank die in Haryana's Hisar
233.article_body: Four men died after they were trapped in a 50-foot-deep sewage tank in Haryana's Hisar, officials said. The deceased's family members and locals protested against the district administration. They demanded ₹1 crore financial assistance and a government job for one family member of each of the deceased. Two of the victims had gone inside the tank to repair a motor.

234.title: Netflix may offer cheaper ad-supported plans amid subscriber loss
234.article_body: Netflix is thinking about offering a lower-priced version of the service with advertising amid a fall in the number of subscribers for the first time in over a decade. Netflix CEO Reed Hastings said that even though he's been "against the complexity of advertising", he's a "bigger fan of consumer choice". Netflix lost 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022.

235.title: Conduct nursing admission through NEET, add 5 new paramedical courses: UP CM
235.article_body: Conduct admission to GNM and BSc nursing courses through the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET), UP CM Yogi Adityanath said while reviewing the action plan of the medical and health departments. "An action plan should be prepared to add five new paramedical courses – OT technician, radiotherapy technician, dialysis technician, anaesthesia technician and MRI technician," he added.

236.title: Fatehabad man arrested for cheating Chandigarh woman of ₹83,979
236.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested a man from Haryana’s Fatehabad for cheating a woman of ₹83,979 in February. The complainant said a man called her over phone, claiming to be a bank employee and informed her of an issue with her credit card. Later, he took details of other credit cards following which a transaction was made from one of her cards.

237.title: Healthcare insurer Loop raises $25 mn, Vinod Khosla invests too
237.article_body: Pune-based healthcare and insurance startup Loop has raised $25 million in a Series B round co-led by General Catalyst and Elevation Capital. The round also saw participation from Vinod Khosla and Khosla Ventures, Sierra Ventures, as well as a new investor, Optum Ventures. The funding follows Loop's $12 million funding from General Catalyst and Elevation six months ago.

238.title: Pre-monsoon showers to hit Maharashtra till Saturday: IMD
238.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light rainfall and thunderstorms across several districts in Maharashtra till Saturday. If it rains, this will reportedly be considered the state's first pre-monsoon rain this year. The day temperatures in the state might also drop marginally during the next three days, IMD predicted.

239.title: I am my own role model: Fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022 Umran Malik
239.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, who is the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022, said, "Speed comes naturally to me. This year I am trying to work on hitting the right areas." He added, "I always used to bowl fast. I am my own role model." He stated, "It is good to see such big legends tweeting about me."

240.title: People say 'you're unadorned' if you don't get surgeries done: Palak Tiwari
240.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari opened up about the double beauty standards she's witnessed in the entertainment industry as a newcomer. She said, "If you have these surgeries...they have things to say about it, but if you don't (get those things done), then you're unadorned and not ready." "So you can never really truly please [the] audience," she added.

241.title: Sri Lanka orders probe after anti-govt protester shot dead by police
241.article_body: Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa said he expects police to "strictly" and "impartially" investigate clashes with anti-government protesters that led to the first death in weeks of civil unrest over an economic crisis. A dozen people were also injured after police fired live ammunition to scatter protesters on Tuesday in Rambukkana town. Rajapaksa said he's "deeply distressed following the tragedy".

242.title: PM Modi announces special AYUSH visa category, AYUSH mark
242.article_body: PM Narendra Modi announced a special AYUSH visa category and AYUSH mark on Wednesday. He said, "Soon, India is going to introduce a special AYUSH visa category for foreign nationals who want to come to India to take advantage of AYUSH therapy." He added, "AYUSH mark will be applied to the highest quality AYUSH products made in India."

243.title: Our next match is against RCB, I want to take Kohli's wicket: Umran Malik
243.article_body: Ahead of SRH's match against RCB on Saturday, pacer Umran Malik said he wants to take Virat Kohli's wicket in that game. "We had a match against LSG...I really wanted to get KL Rahul out...[now] I want to get Kohli out. I'm a big fan of both of them," he stated. During the SRH-LSG match, T Natarajan dismissed Rahul.

244.title: Hyd's 216-year-old British Residency to reopen for public in May
244.article_body: The 216-year-old British Residency in Hyderabad has been restored and it'll be open for public from May, Telangana Minister V Srinivas Goud said. "It was in 2013 that the building was taken up for restoration by World Monuments Fund...at a cost of ₹17 crore," an official said. It served as a seat of power for the British in Hyderabad.

245.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala cuts stake in SAIL from 1.09% to 0.32%
245.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala cut his stake in the Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) during the January-March quarter, data on the company's website showed. As of January 14, Rekha Jhunjhunwala, Rakesh's wife, owned a 0.49% stake in SAIL while Rakesh Jhunjhunwala owned a 0.32% stake. He had earlier cut his stake from 1.76% to 1.09% in December 2021.

246.title: Never hit Amber Heard or any woman in my life: Johnny Depp tells court
246.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor denied all the domestic abuse allegations against him and called them "heinous". "Never did I...reach the point of striking Ms Heard in any way, nor have I ever struck any woman in my life," he added. Earlier, Amber's lawyer had accused Depp of penetrating Amber with a liquor bottle.

247.title: Phones of Raut, Khadse tapped by labelling them 'anti-social': Police
247.article_body: Phones of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut and Nationalist Congress Party leader Eknath Khadse were tapped after labelling them both as "anti-social" elements, Mumbai Police said. Khadse's phone was tapped for 67 days and that of Raut for 60 days, police added. This comes after police started the investigation into the illegal phone tapping case against IPS officer Rashmi Shukla.

248.title: Garbage trucks' fitness certificates must: BBMP after 3 deaths in month
248.article_body: BBMP has mandated fitness certificates for all garbage trucks, including those belonging to contractors. This comes a day after a 40-year-old woman died when a BBMP's garbage truck ran over her, third such fatal incident within a month in Bengaluru. Meanwhile, BBMP chief Gaurav Gupta said that they're working with transport and traffic police department to enhance road safety measures.

249.title: Four-lane service road to come up between Kalindi Kunj, Maharani Bagh
249.article_body: A 6-km-long four-lane service road will come up along the river banks between South Delhi's Maharani Bagh and Kalindi Kunj areas, according to officials. The service roads will help people commuting between Noida and Delhi and will provide relief to residents of densely populated areas like Okhla, Jamia Nagar, Batla House and more, an official said.

250.title: 12 shops gutted in fire at Pune's Kharadi, no casualties reported
250.article_body: Twelve shops were gutted in a fire that broke out in Pune's Kharadi area on Wednesday, fire officials said. The fire started in one of the shops in the Ubale Nagar area at 10 am, they added. Six fire tenders that were rushed to the spot took one hour to douse the fire. No casualties were reported in the incident.

251.title: Starlink helped restore 10 km of cable connection between villages: Ukraine
251.article_body: Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has said SpaceX's Starlink helped restore 10 kilometres of cable connection between villages quickly in the Chernihiv region. "It wouldn't be possible to restore 10 km of...connection between villages...after serious battles so quick. Normally it takes few months," he added. Baryshivka-Net resumed the network for five villages with one Starlink.

252.title: Malegaon blast case witness asks MP Police for security, fears going missing
252.article_body: A witness in Malegaon blast case, Jitendra Bhakroda, has asked for security from Madhya Pradesh Police. Reports said that Bhakroda did not appear in the NIA court recently and stated that he fears that he will also go missing like another witness, Dilip Patidar. "Dilip is still missing after...being taken away by Maharashtra's Anti-Terrorism Squad...in November 2008," he said.

253.title: Class 3 boy peeps out of school bus window, dies after head hits pole in UP
253.article_body: A class 3 boy died on Wednesday after his head hit a pole while he was peeping out school bus window in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. "Based on the allegations of laxity levelled by his family against the school, we've taken the authorities for questioning," police said. The family said the school authorities told them that he peeped out to vomit.

254.title: Uber hikes fare rates by 10% in Bengaluru amid rise in fuel prices
254.article_body: Uber has announced a 10% hike in its fare rates in Bengaluru amid a rise in fuel prices. An official said the move was "to help cushion drivers from the impact of a spike in fuel prices", adding it'll continue to track fuel prices and take further steps as needed. Ola is yet to take a decision on hiking fares.

255.title: 12 shops gutted in fire in Pune's Kharadi, no casualty reported
255.article_body: Twelve shops were gutted in a fire that started in Kharadi area of Pune on Wednesday, officials said, adding that no casualties were reported. Six fire tenders were sent to the spot and the fire was doused in one hour. In Kharadi area, several shops are located next to each other and there are some furniture outlets and eateries too.

256.title: 2 mobile phone thieves held in Pune, 46 stolen phones worth ₹10 lakh seized
256.article_body: Two history-sheeters have been arrested for allegedly stealing mobile phones from bus passengers and those waiting at bus stops in Pune and 46 stolen phones worth ₹10 lakh were seized from them. The matter came to light after the duo snatched the mobile phone of a man who had come to a bus stop near Sassoon hospital.

257.title: Nimrat Kaur shares pic of transformation after gaining 15 kg for 'Dasvi'
257.article_body: Nimrat Kaur shared pictures showing her transformation for the film 'Dasvi'. Revealing that she gained around 15 kg, Nimrat wrote that while she relished the process after an initial hesitation, some around her often gave her snide remarks. She concluded by asking people to be more sensitive, while adding, "Make only your mind and body your business. No one else's."

258.title: 13-yr-old girl raped by 80 men in 8 months in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana
258.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was raped by 80 men in eight months at different brothels in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana after she was taken away by a woman. Police identified Sawarna Kumari as the main accused who forced the minor into prostitution. The police, who said they are searching for some more accused, on Tuesday made 10 arrests.

259.title: Hid face from Shweta Tiwari, no one else: Palak on being clicked with Ibrahim
259.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari said she hid her face from her mother Shweta Tiwari when she was photographed with Ibrahim Ali Khan. "I...told her one hour back that I've left for home...I was like 'mummy there's...so much traffic'...and she was like 'fine'...The second paps came I was like 'mom will see me'...she sent me that picture...said 'you bl***y liar'," Palak added.

260.title: Ranchi woman duped of ₹3.45 lakh on pretext of winning ₹25 lakh lottery, 2 held
260.article_body: Two people were arrested for allegedly duping a 41-year-old woman in Jharkhand's Ranchi. The accused had reached out to her through e-mail, saying she won a lottery of ₹25 lakh and a luxury car, police said. They then asked the woman to pay ₹3.45 lakh to claim the prize money. However,  the duo stopped responding after receiving the money.

261.title: Virat Kohli is overcooked, cannot lose his services with a fried brain: Ravi Shastri
261.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, who has scored 119 runs for RCB in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.83, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Kohli is overcooked." He added, "He needs a break because he has got six to seven years of cricket left in him and you don't want to lose that with a fried brain."

262.title: China doubles purchase of Russian coking coal amid discount
262.article_body: China more than doubled imports of coking coal from Russia in March, buying it at a discount as other nations ban Russian imports due to the Russia-Ukraine war. China's coking coal imports from Russia jumped to 1.4 million tonnes in March 2022, compared to 5,50,000 tonnes for March 2021. Coking coal is essential for the production of iron and steel.

263.title: PM Modi gives WHO chief a Gujarati name 'Tulsibhai'; his reaction goes viral
263.article_body: While addressing an event in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi gave WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus a Gujarati name 'Tulsibhai', based on the Tulsi herbal plant. The WHO chief, who was sharing the stage with PM Modi, could be seen laughing in the viral video. "He (Tedros) told me 'I'm fully Gujarati now. Give me a Gujarati name'," PM Modi said.

264.title: Switch off bulldozers of hate, switch on power plants: Rahul to PM
264.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to "switch off bulldozers of hate and switch on power plants". Gandhi's reference was to the use of bulldozers in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and Madhya Pradesh. Referring to the coal shortage issue, Gandhi added, "Modi ji, stagflation is looming. Power cuts will crush small industries, leading to more job losses."

265.title: Pakistan's 1st Sikh police officer allegedly kidnapped by Pak intelligence agencies
265.article_body: BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa in a Twitter post said, "Pakistan media speculates that first Sikh police officer of Pakistan Gulab Singh Shaheen has allegedly been abducted by Pakistan intelligence agencies and taken to some undisclosed place." "We are concerned about his safety and family. Urging High Commission of India in Pakistan to address this issue at earliest," he added.

266.title: COVID-19 situation completely under control in Maharashtra: Health Min Tope
266.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that COVID-19 situation in the state is "completely under control". "I've held a detailed review of COVID-19 situation in the state. There is no need to worry as there has not been a significant rise in cases," he added. "We are vaccinating those in the 12-15 & 15-18 age groups," he further said.

267.title: Xbox head of research & design quits Microsoft after nearly 20 yrs
267.article_body: Xbox's head of research and design Chris Novak has announced that he is leaving Microsoft after nearly 20 years. In his latest role, Novak led the user experience for things like Xbox Game Pass, Xbox Cloud Gaming, and Xbox Live, according to his LinkedIn. At Microsoft, he also held the roles of Design Architect and Design Director.

268.title: Odisha curtails summer vacation for universities, colleges to 16 days
268.article_body: The Odisha government has curtailed summer vacation for all higher education institutions to 16 days in order to compensate for the academic loss due to COVID-19 pandemic. As per order, the summer vacation will be allowed only from June 1 to June 16 this year.  If needed, extra classes should be held on holidays and working days, the order read.

269.title: Centre extends ceasefire agreements with 3 Naga insurgent groups by a year
269.article_body: The Central government has extended the ceasefire agreements signed with three Naga insurgent groups for one more year. The agreements have been established with the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-NK (NSCN-NK), National Socialist Council of Nagaland- Reformation (NSCN-R) and National Socialist Council of Nagaland K-Khango (NSCN K-Khango), the Union Home Ministry said in a statement.

270.title: I was a Miss India but was offered item songs or five-minute glam roles: Sonali
270.article_body: Speaking about her journey in Bollywood, actress Sonali Seygall, who starred in 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' said she didn't get any work between her first film and second film. She added. "I was a Miss India. I was...offered item songs or five-minute glam roles." "People...assume...good looking people can't act until you prove yourself as Deepika Padukone did in 'Cocktail'," she said.

271.title: Parts of Pune to not receive water supply on April 21
271.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said there'll be no water supply in some parts of the city on April 21. The affected areas will be Aundh, Baner, ITI Road, Spicer college, Bopodi, Old Mumbai-Pune road, and Anand Park. The water supply will be disrupted because the pipeline near Sindh Society has to be shifted for Pune Metro work, PMC said.

272.title: Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas, he says Kejriwal will one day betray Punjab CM
272.article_body: Punjab Police have registered a case against Kumar Vishwas for promoting enmity by allegedly making false statements against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Tagging Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, Vishwas tweeted, "I'm warning you that the man sitting in Delhi, whom you are allowing to play with the power given by the people of Punjab, will one day betray you and Punjab."

273.title: Telangana BJP to launch state-wide protests against 'atrocities’ by TRS
273.article_body: The Telangana unit of the BJP has decided to hold state-wide protests on Wednesday against the "atrocities, murders and abetment of suicides by the TRS leaders". This came after a member of the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh, B Sai Ganesh, allegedly killed himself by consuming pesticide in Khammam after accusing TRS leaders of corruption.

274.title: Use masks in closed spaces, advises Karanataka government
274.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi, the Karnataka government has advised the use of face masks at least in closed spaces and indoors to prevent the spread of coronavirus in the state. "Once...cases spike in Delhi, it also tends to increase in other parts...like Bengaluru. It's good for us to exercise caution," Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar said.

275.title: Railways to waterproof Mumbai's AC locals ahead of monsoon
275.article_body: Central Railway will waterproof all Mumbai AC local trains ahead of monsoon to ensure that rain water does not enter the electrical systems placed on the roof of the trains. "Waterproofing is done for additional safety...As the electrical system is not present inside the underslung, minimal waterlogging on tracks will not impact operations," said a senior Central Railway official.

276.title: What's happening with umpiring in IPL 2022, it's quite pathetic: Kris Srikkanth
276.article_body: Ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth has criticised the umpiring in the ongoing IPL season, stating that it's quite pathetic and "small bad decisions are leading to big outcomes". He added, "Wake up and put some people who actually can be [umpires]." During the RCB-LSG match, Hazlewood's wide delivery wasn't called wide, leading to Marcus Stoinis' wicket on the next ball.

277.title: I was so raw, it's embarrassing: Ayushmann on watching 'Vicky..' after 10 yrs
277.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana watched a scene from his debut film 'Vicky Donor' after ten years. "I was so raw, it's embarrassing," Ayushmann said, adding, "I'm so much better now! I'm seriously watching it after 10 years. I don't watch my films. I only watch them on the edit and maybe on the screening. It's just too much."

278.title: I had b***s to fight the system when you were in your father's: Jayawardena to troll
278.article_body: After former Sri Lankan cricketer Mahela Jayawardena condemned police in Sri Lanka opening fire at anti-government protesters amid economic crisis, a man tweeted, "Sudden growth of b***s." Responding to the troll, Jayawardena wrote, "I had b***s to fight the system when you were in your father's…so don’t worry about mine. Stay [focussed]."

279.title: Trolling not done, kindly make amends: Ex-cricketer Ganesh to LSG for calling RCB 'beta'
279.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh criticised LSG for calling RCB 'beta' on Twitter. Ahead of LSG-RCB match, LSG had tweeted, "Pesh hain aaj ke Playing XI...RCB beta...tumse na ho payega!" Ganesh tweeted, "Friendly banters are always welcome in cricket. But trolling isn't done. A new team calling a team which's been part of IPL since 2008 Beta...isn't banter. Kindly make amends."

280.title: Shanghai allows 4 mn people to leave their homes as COVID rules ease
280.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai on Wednesday allowed four million people out of their homes as coronavirus rules in the city eased. Almost 12 million people in the city of 25 million are now allowed to go outdoors following the first round of easing last week, an official said. Shanghai had put most of its population under lockdown on March 28.

281.title: BharatPe appoints Smriti Handa as Chief Human Resources Officer
281.article_body: BharatPe has appointed former Reckitt Global Talent Acquisition Director Smriti Handa as its Chief Human Resources Officer. Handa will work closely with the senior leadership team and focus on strengthening the organisational culture and HR practices, BharatPe said. Handa also held the position of Regional HR Director South Asia at Reckitt.

282.title: He's in jail, yet been named in FIR: Woman on son's name in MP clashes
282.article_body: Sakeena, mother of Shahbaz who has been named in FIR after violence that took place in Madhya Pradesh on Ram Navami, said that her son is already in jail and still has been named in the FIR. "It's being said...he's set motorcycles on fire and has pelted stones...How did he get out of jail to do all this?" she asked.

283.title: How Koreans will become a year younger with change in centuries-old counting method?
283.article_body: South Koreans will become a year younger as country's president-elect Yoon Suk-yeol is planning to abolish a centuries-old method of counting. South Koreans are labeled as one year old at birth and another year is added upon the New Year. The incoming administration is doing this in order to bring South Korea in line with rest of the world.

284.title: Uttarakhand government transfers 22 IAS officers
284.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami-led government transferred 22 Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officers. Former IPS Abhinav Kumar has retained his position as a Special Principal Secretary to the CM again. R Meenakshi Sundaram has been made Secretary to the CM. Radha Raturi has been given the Home Department in the state government.

285.title: Delhi makes face masks mandatory again, ₹500 fine for violators
285.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) on Wednesday decided to make face masks mandatory again for citizens with a fine of ₹500 for violators. This comes after Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that a meeting has been scheduled with the experts and DDMA on April 20. Delhi on Tuesday reported 632 new cases of COVID-19.

286.title: When Kohli hits his straps, final piece of puzzle will be in place for RCB: Hogg
286.article_body: After RCB's win against LSG on Tuesday, former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said the Faf Du Plessis-led side is quickly becoming the favourites in the ongoing IPL season. "When Virat Kohli hits his straps...final piece of the puzzle will be in place for RCB," he added. So far, Kohli has scored 119 runs in their seven games.

287.title: Ukraine given more aircraft, spare parts: Pentagon
287.article_body: The US' Pentagon has said that the Ukrainian military has received additional aircraft and spare parts to repair the damaged ones to help them in their fight against Russia. Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby, however, did not reveal which countries provided the aircraft. Ukraine has more operable fighter planes than it had two weeks ago, he added.

288.title: After US and UK, Canada imposes sanctions on Putin’s daughters
288.article_body: Days after the US and the UK imposed sanctions against Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters, Canada announced similar measures in view of the ongoing Ukraine war. The country in a statement said that it was imposing targeted sanctions against 14 persons connected with Russia, which included Putin's two adult daughters - Katerina Vladimirovna Tikhonova and Maria Vladimirovna Vorontsova.

289.title: Tamil Nadu govt plans to develop airport in Hosur industrial belt
289.article_body: Tamil Nadu government is planning to develop an airport in the industrial belt of Hosur, located about 40 km from Bengaluru. State Industries Minister Thangam Thenarasu on Tuesday, said Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation Ltd (TIDCO) has been directed to study the air traffic, market demand and other aspects. TIDCO will reportedly select a consultant for undertaking the study.

290.title: Demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri stops after SC steps in for 2nd time
290.article_body: The anti-encroachment drive has been stopped in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area, said Special Commissioner of Police, Law & Order, Delhi Police. This comes after the Supreme Court ordered that authorities must be directed to stop the demolition drive. Earlier today, the Supreme Court had stayed the demolition drive, however, the demolition continued for about an hour after that.

291.title: My friend's mom said 'Your making-out scene was very good': Isha Talwar
291.article_body: Sharing the reactions to her performance in Rishi Kapoor-starrer 'Sharmaji Namkeen', actress Isha Talwar said, "My friend's mom messaged me saying that my making out scene was very good and that I look really sexy." "This is the best feedback I have got so far," added Isha. "It has been very sweet and...very heartwarming," stated Isha.

292.title: Met Mira 10 times before marriage; I still wonder 'how did it happen': Shahid
292.article_body: When asked how getting married to Mira Rajput changed him, Shahid Kapoor said, "Mine was an arranged marriage. It wasn't a love marriage or friends who've known each other for a long time choosing to settle and [living] their lives together." "We met...10 times before we got married...When I look back even I wonder, 'How did it happen?'" he added.

293.title: Contempt petition filed against Raut for levelling allegations against HC judges
293.article_body: Indian Bar Association has filed a contempt petition-cum-PIL against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut and others for levelling "false, scandalous and contemptuous allegations" against judges of Bombay High Court in granting relief to BJP's Kirit Somaiya. The PIL also seeked action against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil and 'Saamana' Editor Rashmi Thackeray in the matter.

294.title: 'Heropanti 2' to feature the biggest action sequence ever filmed: Reports
294.article_body: Actors Tiger Shroff and Nawazuddin Siddiqui's upcoming film 'Heropanti 2' will reportedly feature the "biggest" action sequence to have ever been filmed. "It took a heart of an action director to tarnish 10 deluxe Lamborghinis," said a source as quoted by the report. "We had to hire the most competent stunt trainers who could make the...process smoother," added the source.

295.title: Comedy films are accorded 2nd class status: Tamil actor Ravi Mariya
295.article_body: Tamil actor Ravi Mariya said comedy films are "accorded" second class status, adding that reviews of such movies do not accord the importance they deserve. "Audiences enjoyed the comedy in [my film] 'Idiot' so much that the theatres reverberated with the sound of clapping...But some media persons said that the film was not funny at all," stated Ravi.

296.title: Apple products had 20% recycled materials in 2021, highest-ever
296.article_body: Apple has revealed that nearly 20% of all material used in Apple products in 2021 was recycled, the highest-ever use of recycled content. For the first time ever for any Apple product, Apple used recycled gold in the main logic board in the iPhone 13 and iPhone13 Pro. Apple products in 2021 included 45% certified recycled rare earth elements.

297.title: Ramayana, Mahabharata, Quran will be part of moral science in K'taka: Min
297.article_body: Moral science will be part of the curriculum from this academic year and won't just be restricted to one religion, the Karnataka Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh said. The essence of all religions including Panchatantra, Ramayana, Mahabharata, Quran and others will be part of moral studies and there will be no exams on the subject, he said.

298.title: UPSC 2015 topper Tina Dabi to marry Pradeep Gawande in Jaipur today
298.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi, who topped Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) examination in 2015 is set to marry senior IAS officer Dr Pradeep Gawande in Jaipur today. The marriage will reportedly take place at a five-star hotel in a private affair. According to reports, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has been invited to the wedding.

299.title: PBKS' Bairstow a big player but should get just 1 more game: Manjrekar
299.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said PBKS batter Jonny Bairstow is a "big" player with a good track record, but deserves just one more opportunity as batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa is in good form. Bairstow has scored 32 runs in three IPL 2022 matches so far for PBKS at a strike rate of 103.22. PBKS will take on DC today.

300.title: 22-yr-old run over by truck as bike skids on waterlogged road in B'luru
300.article_body: A 22-year-old man died as he was run over by a truck after his bike skidded on a waterlogged road in Bengaluru on Monday. His friend, who was the pillion rider, also suffered injuries in the accident. The mishap took place at Sampangiramnagar road near Corporation Circle when they were returning home from shopping after heavy rains.

301.title: Woke mind virus making Netflix unwatchable: Musk as Netflix loses members
301.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "The woke mind virus is making Netflix unwatchable." The tweet came after Netflix reported losing subscribers for the first time in more than 10 years. When a Twitter user said, "Not just Netflix. Movies in general, videogames, TV, they're all infested with current year trend woke garbage," Musk responded, "True".

302.title: Zoho's billionaire CEO shares pics of office made with mud/straw, says 'I love it so much'
302.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu took to Twitter to share pictures of his company's new conference room and small offices. He wrote, "New conference room and small offices, built with mud/straw and limestone cover, upstairs covered by thatched palm leaf. Comfortable even on a hot day." He added, "I love it so much I have made it my office!"

303.title: Ex-eBay exec to plead guilty to cyberstalking campaign against couple
303.article_body: James Baugh, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, will plead guilty to running a 2019 cyberstalking campaign against a couple who ran a website critical of eBay. Baugh is one of seven former eBay workers charged with harassing the couple behind the newsletter EcommerceBytes. Baugh's lawyers had requested a hearing for him to plead guilty on April 25.

304.title: Delhi records highest temperature in April in 11 years at 42.6°C: IMD
304.article_body: Delhi's Safdarjung observatory on Tuesday recorded a temperature of 42.6°C, the highest in April in the last 11 years, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. The all-time highest temperature on a day in April is 46.5°C which was recorded in 2010, as per IMD data. Eight stations in Delhi witnessed "a heatwave to severe heat conditions" on Tuesday, it added.

305.title: Taiwanese news channel falsely claims China has invaded Taiwan
305.article_body: A news channel in Taiwan falsely claimed that China had launched an invasion just outside the capital Taipei. Taipei-based Chinese Television Systems, a TV network partially owned by the Taiwanese government, ran a ticker along the bottom of the screen at 7 am local time on Wednesday. The station issued an apology live on air a few hours later.

306.title: Didn't get space in 'Vicky..' release, perhaps they don't like ugly faces : Annu
306.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor said that he felt let down by the producers for not giving him any space or promotion during the release of 'Vicky Donor'. "They just wanted to highlight and promote the hero...I have always faced this kind of partiality for a long time...Perhaps they don't like ugly faces like Annu Kapoor," he added.

307.title: Hotel owner gropes woman for objecting to unpalatable food in Mumbai, held
307.article_body: An owner of a Gorai-based hotel in Mumbai was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing a social activist. The complainant, along with her daughter, had visited the Chinese food outlet on April 17. However, when she objected to the taste of the food, a verbal brawl erupted between the woman and the hotel owner who then allegedly groped her.

308.title: Masaba Gupta is the greatest designer and celeb ever: Sonam Kapoor
308.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor said on Instagram that fashion designer Masaba Gupta is the "greatest" designer and celeb ever, adding that she is "sucking up" to Masaba publicly as she can't wait for her baby bump clothes anymore. "She's...not made my baby bump clothes yet," stated Sonam. Discussing her pregnancy, Sonam had shared that she cannot sleep sometimes.

309.title: Chandigarh might bar unvaccinated kids from attending school
309.article_body: The Chandigarh administration on Tuesday said they may bar unvaccinated kids from attending school amid the COVID-19 surge. "The unvaccinated children may be advised not to attend physical classes in the next few days," Chandigarh's health secretary Yashpal Garg said. "Though the anti-COVID vaccination is voluntary, it is worth mentioning that vaccines are safe for the children," he added.

310.title: Pune man sexually assaults teen whose mother considered him brother, held
310.article_body: The Pune Police have arrested a 25-year-old man, Tejas Suresh Ahivale, for sexually assaulting a teenager whose mother reportedly considered him a brother. The accused allegedly assaulted the 14-year-old victim over five to six months and also threatened to kill her parents if she told anyone about it. The girl was later found to be four months pregnant.

311.title: With 6 wickets down, even big players can't deliver: Ajay Jadeja on PBKS
311.article_body: Talking about seventh-placed PBKS, ex-India player Ajay Jadeja said, "Once six wickets are down, even big players become no big." "PBKS have two solid openers and their 'go big' players are batting way behind," added Ajay. "[Batter] Shahrukh Khan is batting too low in the order. His talent needs to be utilised properly," stated Ajay.

312.title: Pic of ₹10 note with message 'Vishal, my wedding is on April 26, elope me' goes viral
312.article_body: A photo of ₹10 note with a message of a woman asking her lover to run away with her before her wedding has gone viral on Twitter. The woman wrote, "Vishal, my wedding is on April 26. Elope me. I love you. Your Kusum." A Twitter user wrote, "Tag all Vishals on this post. We will make them meet."

313.title: She is a new mother now: Anushka's brother on her quitting as a producer
313.article_body: Anushka Sharma and her brother Karnesh Sharma started Clean Slate Filmz together. Speaking about her decision to quit as a producer, her brother Karnesh said, "Clean Slate Filmz was started by her, so nobody can take that away." "Her priority...shifted...because producing is a 24/7 job and you can't expect her to do that as she's a mother now," he added.

314.title: Salah scores brace as Liverpool defeat Man Utd 4-0 to go top of EPL points table
314.article_body: Liverpool defeated Manchester United 4-0 to jump into the first spot on the Premier League points table. Liverpool's Luis Diaz scored the opening goal in the fifth minute of the game while Mohamed Salah made it 2-0 in the 22nd minute. Salah scored another in the second half along with Sadio Mane. United are placed sixth on points table.

315.title: Couple & their 5 kids asleep in hut burnt alive in house fire in Punjab
315.article_body: Seven members of a family were burnt alive as their hut caught fire on Wednesday morning in Punjab's Ludhiana. Police said that they were migrant labourers and were asleep in their hut near the municipal garbage dump yard on Tibba road. The victims include a couple and their five children.

316.title: Police bust cricket betting racket in Bengaluru, seize ₹1.93 lakh cash
316.article_body: Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police have busted a cricket betting racket and arrested the organiser. Police also seized ₹1.93 lakh cash and a mobile phone from the accused. "A case has been filed with Annapurneshwari Nagar Police, and further investigation is underway," the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said in a tweet on Wednesday.

317.title: Ludhiana chemist held with intoxicant pills, ₹1.65 lakh drug money
317.article_body: Ludhiana Rural Police’s CIA staff arrested a chemist with a cache of intoxicant pills, syrups and ₹1.65 lakh drug money on Monday. The accused had hidden the intoxicant pills at his house. Police have recovered 29,370 intoxicant pills and 35 syrups besides the drug money. The accused runs a chemist shop near Adda Raikot in Jagraon, a police official said.

318.title: No plan to impose fine for not wearing face masks in Delhi: Sisodia
318.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has said that the government is not planning to impose a fine for not wearing face masks in the national capital. "As of now, there is no need to panic as there are lower counts in the COVID-19 cases, and a meeting has been scheduled with the experts and DDMA on April 20," Sisodia added.

319.title: LSG's Marcus Stoinis screams 'F**k you' in anger after getting out, reprimanded
319.article_body: LSG all-rounder Marcus Stoinis was heard screaming 'F**k you' in anger after getting dismissed by RCB's Josh Hazlewood in their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. Stoinis was also seen gesturing angrily with his bat. Stoinis has been reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct. He admitted to Level 1 offence of IPL Code of Conduct and accepted the sanction.

320.title: Woman from Delhi gangraped in moving autorickshaw in UP
320.article_body: A woman from Delhi was gangraped in a moving autorickshaw by its driver and his two accomplices in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh district. The accused also robbed the woman of her purse which contained ₹20,000. The woman, who came to Aligarh from Delhi via bus, alleged that the accused also thrashed her when she resisted the crime.

321.title: Centre approves 477 pesticides for drone usage to fast track agri-drone adoption
321.article_body: The central government has granted interim approval to 477 pesticides for drone usage to fast track agri-drone adoption, the Drone Federation of India said. Earlier, each pesticide had to be approved by CIB&RC which would take 18-24 months. It's a step towards reaching the vision of "one village one drone" in the next three years, DFI President Smit Shah said.

322.title: Police seize truck with 35 cattle in Assam's Biswanath, 5 arrested
322.article_body: Assam Police rescued 35 cattle from a truck in Assam's Biswanath district on Tuesday, officials said. Based on a tip-off, a team of Biswanath police had intercepted the truck, returning from the Laluk area of Assam's Lakhimpur, and arrested five persons on charges of animal cruelty. "A case has been registered in connection with it," Biswanath SP Navin Singh said.

323.title: KL Rahul breaches IPL Code of Conduct, fined 20% of match fee
323.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul has been fined 20% of his match fee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team's IPL 2022 match against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on Tuesday. Rahul admitted to the Level 1 offence of the IPL Code of Conduct and accepted the sanction, the IPL said in a statement.

324.title: Father of UP boy killed in Canada seeks study loan waiver
324.article_body: The father of Kartik Vasudev, the student who was shot dead in Canada's Toronto days ago, has demanded the government to waive off the education loan he took for his son. "We mortgaged our house and ornaments to send him to Canada for MBA," said the father. He also demanded free education and a government job for his younger son.

325.title: Will hold Twitter board accountable over Musk's bid rejection: US governor
325.article_body: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has said the state will seek ways to hold Twitter's board "accountable" over the rejection of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy the platform. The state will hold the board "accountable for breaching their fiduciary duty", he said. "They rejected it because they know that they can't control Elon Musk," DeSantis said.

326.title: SC halts demolition in Delhi's violence-hit Jahangirpuri, orders status quo
326.article_body: Less than an hour after the bulldozers rolled in Jahangirpuri in New Delhi to begin an anti-encroachment drive, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said it would take up the matter for hearing tomorrow and ordered status quo till then. The demolition drive comes days after communal clashes broke out in the area in which at least nine policemen were injured.

327.title: Putin's executioners killed Ukrainian who shares my name: Navalny
327.article_body: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny accused Russian President Vladimir Putin's "executioners" of killing a 60-year-old man in Ukraine's Bucha because he shared the Navalny surname. "Apparently, they hoped he was my relative," he said. Navalny shared a picture on Twitter of a passport with the name Ilya Ivanovich Navalny that he said was deliberately left next to the dead body.

328.title: BJP leader held for putting saffron flag in Amravati leading to clash
328.article_body: Police have detained Abhay Matne, BJP’s Achalpur city unit chief and seven to eight persons from the party for allegedly putting up a saffron flag at Dulha Gate on Sunday. According to police, the act of hoisting saffron flag led to a clash between two communities following which a curfew was imposed in Amravati's Achalpur and its twin city Paratwada.

329.title: Youth surrenders for killing neighbour over verbal spat in Vadodara, held
329.article_body: A youth was arrested in Vadodara after he surrendered for allegedly murdering his 47-year-old neighbour in the Danteshwar area of the city. On Tuesday, the deceased got involved in a verbal spat with the accused, according to the police. The deceased allegedly verbally abused the accused’s mother and sister, provoking him to attack, police said.

330.title: North Delhi civic body conducts anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri
330.article_body: North Delhi Municipal Corporation has started conducting an anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri. The drive will be done on illegal construction in the area on April 20 and 21. The civic body has asked for 400 personnel from Delhi Police to maintain the law and order situation during the drive. North-West district DCP Usha Rangnani inspected the area on Wednesday morning.

331.title: Asha remembers sister Lata Mangeshkar on 'Dance...', says 'She's still with me'
331.article_body: In the upcoming episode of 'Dance India Dance Little Masters', singer Asha Bhosle will appear as a guest judge. The channel shared a promo from the upcoming episode, in which two contestants performed imitating Asha and her late sister, singer Lata Mangeshkar. Their performance left Asha Bhosle in tears. She said, "My sister...left this world but she's still with me."

332.title: We're methodically carrying out our plan in eastern Ukraine: Russia
332.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said Russian forces are "methodically carrying out" plans to "liberate" two breakaway regions, Donetsk and Luhansk, in eastern Ukraine. The US and West are trying to prolong Moscow's military operation, he said, adding, "The increasing volume of foreign arms supplies...shows their intentions to provoke the Kyiv regime to fight to the last Ukrainian standing."

333.title: Rishabh Pant's form is going to be very important for DC: Manjrekar
333.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said Rishabh Pant's form is going to be very important for DC in their upcoming games. "Pant hasn't fired completely...Both Shaw and Warner are high-risk players and there might be a problem if DC lose a couple of early wickets," he explained. So far, Pant hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in their five games.

334.title: BJP has declared war, is punishing Muslims for daring to stay alive: Owaisi
334.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi took to Twitter to say that the Bharatiya Janata Party has declared war against the poorest. "In the name of encroachment it's going to destroy homes in Delhi like UP & MP. No notice, no opportunity to go to court...simply punishing poor Muslims for daring to stay alive...@ArvindKejriwal must clarify his dubious role," the tweet read.

335.title: 1,900 sites inspected for anti-open burning campaign in Delhi: Govt
335.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Tuesday said the government had so far inspected 1,915 sites as part of its anti-open burning campaign. Further, a total of 21 notices or challans have also been issued to violators, he added. The minister said that a high-level meeting to solve Delhi's landfill fire problem will be held on April 21.

336.title: Sidharth Malhotra joins Rohit Shetty's cop universe, shares first picture
336.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra will now be a part of filmmaker Rohit Shetty's cop universe. Sharing a glimpse of his look on Instagram, Sidharth wrote, "Rohit Shetty's cop universe goes digital tomorrow at 11 AM!" Rohit also shared the post and wrote, "Action begins tomorrow." Actor Anupam Kher wished him luck and commented on the picture, "Good luck, my friend!"

337.title: Nazara to acquire 35% stake in Brandscale Innovations for ₹10 cr
337.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed gaming platform Nazara Technologies' arm Nodwin Gaming's board has approved the acquisition of 35% stake in Brandscale Innovations for around ₹10 crore. Nazara has also invested in gaming accessories brand Wings, which designs and deals in high-quality and affordable gaming audio gear. Earlier, Nazara announced it will be investing ₹18 cr in US-based Bitkraft Ventures.

338.title: UP couple injured in blast in J&K's Rajouri
338.article_body: A married couple from Uttar Pradesh sustained injuries after what the police are calling a "mysterious explosion" took place near a slum in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Tuesday. The victims were identified as 25-year-old Vinod Kumar and 20-year-old Kranti Devi. The two were said to be stable after being hospitalised, according to police.

339.title: 6 TRS leaders held in mother-son suicide case in Telangana
339.article_body: At least six leaders of Telangana's ruling party Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), including Ramayampet Municipal Chairman Palle Jitender Goud, were arrested in a mother-son suicide case. They were accused of abetting the suicide of a real estate businessman and his mother in Kamareddy, police said. The victims had set themselves ablaze, accusing TRS leaders and a circle inspector of harassment.

340.title: 2 terror accused met Pak Army Major seen in pic with IAF pilot Abhinandan: Delhi Police
340.article_body: Two men arrested by Delhi Police on terror charges have allegedly identified a Pakistani Army Major whom they had met while undergoing training by ISI in Pakistan. They identified "Major Hamza" from a photograph shown of IAF Group Captain Abhinandan Varthaman who was in Pakistani custody for a brief spell three years ago, according to a chargesheet filed in court.

341.title: Rainfall, thunderstorm predicted in several states; list released
341.article_body: The IMD has predicted fairly widespread rainfall over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Sikkim, and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal during the next four days. Under the influence of a Western Disturbance, light isolated rainfall with thunderstorms, lightning, gusty winds likely over Punjab and Haryana, and Delhi on April 20 and 21.

342.title: Russian army is most barbaric and inhuman: Ukraine Prez
342.article_body: The Russian army is writing itself into history forever as the most barbaric and inhuman army in the world, said Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "They have driven almost everyone and everything that is capable of fighting us against Ukraine," he said in a video address to his country. The Russians are not allowing humanitarian corridors, he added.

343.title: Bodies of Nepalese woman, infant found hanging in Shimla's Ratnari
343.article_body: The bodies of a Nepalese woman and her nine-month-old child were found hanging in Shimla's Ratnari village, the police said. The woman's husband found the bodies when he returned from work and took down the bodies before the arrival of the police. The family is originally from Nepal and worked in an apple orchard in Shimla.

344.title: Actor Ezra Miller throws chair at woman, arrested for second-degree assault
344.article_body: Days after being arrested on charges of disorderly conduct and harassment at a bar in Hawaii, actor Ezra Miller, who portrayed The Flash in DC's 'Justice League', was arrested again for a second-degree assault. Miller was arrested after he threw a chair at a 26-year-old woman on being asked to leave a get-together. Police are investigating the matter.

345.title: It took 10 years: Taapsee on working with Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dunki'
345.article_body: Speaking about working with Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani in 'Dunki', Taapsee Pannu took to Twitter to share her excitement. She wrote, "A superstar once said...'When you wish for something with all your heart...entire universe conspires to get it for you.' Cheers to honesty, hard work and perseverance. It took 10 years but finally 'All is Well'."

346.title: Dad started work at 15, left house with ₹20; mom restarted career at 56: Karan
346.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra said that he is privileged because his father started working at the age of 15 and left house with ₹20. Karan added that his mother restarted her career as a registered nurse in the US. "When parents got married, my dad went back to his Air Force base and mom went to her hostel," he further said.

347.title: Govt to run check on those coming for Char Dham Yatra: U'khand CM
347.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said those coming to the state on Char Dham Yatra will have to undergo proper verification so that those who may pose a threat to peace are kept out. "Our state is a peaceful state...Those doing riots, creating enmity or spreading hate in the name of religion do not have any place here," Dhami stated.

348.title: The bounce was unreal with the new ball: Hazlewood on 4/25 vs LSG
348.article_body: RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood said the bounce was unreal at the DY Patil Stadium and it helped him to create opportunities to take wickets in the first few overs against LSG. "If you get it right you can create opportunities...We have got a well-rounded bowling attack," he added. Hazlewood picked four wickets, conceding 25 runs in the game.

349.title: Maha seeks removal of 22 social media accounts with 'communal disharmony posts'
349.article_body: The Maharashtra Cyber Cell has proposed to block 22 social media accounts for "propagating communal disharmony" in the wake of communal clashes incidents reported in some states. On observing the current atmosphere (of the country), 48 police stations under the department are actively filtering out accounts that post objectionable and defamatory content, a senior police officer said.

350.title: Man dies in police custody in Bhubaneswar, 2 women claim body
350.article_body: A man, identified as Pradip Sahu by the police who was caught in a cycle theft case, died in police custody in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, officials said. A woman claimed that the man was not Sahu but her husband, Devendra Choudhary. Notably, another woman also reached the police station to claim the man's body and said that he is her husband.

351.title: Elon Musk willing to invest up to $15 billion of own money to buy Twitter: Report
351.article_body: Elon Musk is willing to invest between $10 billion and $15 billion of his own money to take Twitter Inc private, the New York Post reported citing two sources. The Tesla CEO and world's richest man, who is Twitter's second-biggest shareholder with a 9.1% stake, is planning to launch an offer in about 10 days, the report added.

352.title: Hopefully a hundred is around the corner: Du Plessis on 96(64) vs LSG
