352.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis, who scored 96(64) runs against LSG, said someone had to stabilise their innings after they lost two early wickets and he's grateful that he could do that. He added that he has scored a few fifty-plus scores now and "hopefully (a ton) is around the corner". Earlier, Plessis scored 88 in their match against PBKS.

353.title: Pups bit Arnav with sharp teeth, it was bleeding: Arun Vijay on Oh My Dog
353.article_body: Actor Arun Vijay said that pups started biting his on and off screen son Arnav Vijay with "sharp teeth" during shoot of 'Oh My Dog'. "He handled it so well...He had no problems with scratches on his hands...it was bleeding...He just put on some sanitiser and then he just went and started doing it again...because he loves dogs," Arun added.

354.title: 50 tonnes of raw material gutted as fire breaks out in Ahmedabad godown
354.article_body: Over 50 tonnes of industrial raw material was gutted in a fire that broke out at Kapsun Resource Corp company's godown in an industrial area near Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Tuesday. The company manufactures industrial water coolers. "Nine water tankers, one fire fighting tanker...over 40 firefighting personnel were rushed to the spot," an official said. No casualty or injury was reported.

355.title: RSS, PFI should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest: CPI(M) leader
355.article_body: CPI(M) Kerala State Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan said that ban on communal outfits was not a solution to check the growing "communal virus" in the country. Speaking about RSS and SDPI workers' killings in Palakkad, he said that the crimes were well-planned. "Both, RSS and PFI, should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest," Balakrishnan added.

356.title: German park renames boar called Putin over Ukraine war
356.article_body: A wild boar, named Putin after the Russian President, got a new name after the authorities at a German animal park decided that the old one was getting uncomfortable following the start of the Ukraine war. After an online poll, the animal, a purebred Russian hog, was renamed as "Eberhofer". Ukrainian names such as Zelenskyy and Klitschko were also suggested.

357.title: A narrative of fine fabrics hand-stitched to perfection: Raymond
357.article_body:
Raymond announced that as India's leading men's fashion brand, it has introduced a fascinating line of fine fabrics to create delightful silhouettes for various celebratory occasions. 
The moments of joy with family deserve an immaculately stylised wardrobe, the brand stated, adding that every fabric from this collection is hand-stitched to perfection, thus making precious moments truly memorable.

358.title: Life on Mars will not be luxurious, it will be difficult: Elon Musk
358.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in an interview with TED head Chris Anderson discussed life on Mars, saying that life there "will not be luxurious", especially in the beginning. "The sales pitch for going to Mars is, 'It's dangerous, it's cramped. You might not make it back. It's difficult, it's hard work,'" Musk said.

359.title: India sees 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, over 65% rise in daily cases
359.article_body: India has reported 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, 1,547 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country saw 1,247 cases and one death. Active COVID-19 cases in India rose to 12,340, while the death toll reached 5,22,006.

360.title: Which bowlers have dismissed Virat Kohli for golden duck in IPL history?
360.article_body: Virat Kohli on Tuesday got out for a golden duck for the fourth time in IPL. Kohli was dismissed by LSG's Dushmantha Chameera. Kohli's first golden duck in IPL came against MI on May 28, 2008, when he was dismissed by Ashish Nehra. Sandeep Sharma and Nathan Coulter-Nile got Kohli out for a first-ball duck in 2014 and 2017, respectively.

361.title: DCP inspects Jahangirpuri area ahead of anti-encroachment drive
361.article_body: Delhi's North-West district DCP Usha Rangnani on Wednesday morning inspected the Jahangirpuri area ahead of the anti-encroachment drive announced by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). This comes after MCD asked for 400 personnel from Delhi Police to handle law and order during the drive. The drive will be done on illegal construction in Jahangirpuri on April 20 and 21.

362.title: 26-year-old man arrested in Pune for murder of 8-year-old child
362.article_body: A 26-year-old man has been arrested for the murder of an eight-year-old child in Pune. The child was reported missing on Sunday and was later found in an unused accommodation a few metres from his house. Police said, "The reports about attempted sexual assault are untrue [and] so far, the motive appears to be money, but it cannot be confirmed."

363.title: No innocent person should be booked in Jahangirpuri violence: Minorities panel
363.article_body: A National Commission for Minorities delegation led by Chairperson Iqbal Singh Lalpura visited Delhi’s violence-hit Jahangirpuri area. The delegation called upon the administration to ensure that no innocent person is booked in the matter and requested to quickly nab the culprits involved in the violence. The delegation took stock of the situation from DCP North West.

364.title: Anupam Kher meets The Great Khali in Delhi, shares pic of himself standing on chair
364.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with former WWE wrestler The Great Khali. Sharing a picture of himself standing on a chair alongside The Great Khali, Anupam wrote on Instagram, "The only way one can be taller than The Great Khali is [this]." "That's a great formula," a user commented on the picture.

365.title: Jahangirpuri arms supplier arrested after encounter, has over 60 cases: Delhi Police
365.article_body: An arms supplier from Delhi's Jahangirpuri area has been nabbed after a brief encounter in which he was injured, said DCP Outer North Brijendra Yadav to ANI on Wednesday. According to DCP Yadav, he is named in more than 60 previous cases. Nine policemen and a civilian were injured in clashes during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Jahangirpuri on Saturday.

366.title: Russian forces steal Ukraine man's AirPods, he uses them to track their movement
366.article_body: A Ukrainian man has been tracking the redeployment of Russia forces via AirPods stolen from him by invading troops. Vitaliy Semenets' AirPods were looted from his home in Hostomel, near Kyiv, soon after the war began as Russia tried to take the Ukrainian capital. He has since been using Find My app to track the movement of Russian forces.

367.title: Can't get out of bed sometimes; it gets difficult: Sonam on pregnancy
367.article_body: Speaking about her pregnancy, actress Sonam Kapoor said her sleep pattern has got disrupted and that she's unable to fulfil her work obligation. "No one warns you how difficult it'll be, but it'll be difficult," she added. "I can't sleep sometimes...I'm...an early riser and it was like [it's] 8:30 AM and I just couldn't get out of bed," Sonam said.

368.title: 11 yrs ago, Adi said look test was my world cup final's penalty kick: Ranveer
368.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh recalled his 'Band Baaja Baaraat' look test that happened 11 years ago. "Adi sir (Aditya Chopra) had told me that this is my world cup final's penalty kick. [He said] 'If you score in this, you are a champion and if not, you can go back home'. Right here. What a moment to remember," he added.

369.title: B'luru records excess rainfall of 151 mm since Mar 1, to receive more showers
369.article_body: India Meteorological Department on Tuesday said Bengaluru would continue to receive scattered rainfall for the next few days. Maximum and minimum temperatures are likely to be around 33°C and 21°C for the next two days, IMD predicted. Bengaluru has recorded 151 mm rainfall from March 1 to April 19, it added, saying, "The city has received excess rainfall so far."

370.title: 72% Mumbai mosques complying with noise rules: Police
370.article_body: Nearly 72 percent of mosques in Mumbai are complying with noise pollution rules and have either stopped using loudspeakers or are keeping their sound very low during azaan, as per Mumbai Police's survey. People have started sending applications seeking permission to use loudspeakers but permission will be granted only if it meets all security parameters, a police officer said.

371.title: Stopped publishing bulletin, sending mails: Kerala Health Min on COVID data
371.article_body: Allegations that Kerala is not giving COVID-19 data to the Centre are absolutely wrong, state Health Minister Veena George said. "We've stopped publishing daily bulletin in the state...have been sending mails," she added. "It's quite unfortunate...a responsible person from Union government is sending letter to Principal Secretary stating that Kerala is not giving data to the Centre," Veena stated.

372.title: Centre’s regressive policies dampening farm sector growth: KCR
372.article_body: Calling the Centre's policies on agriculture regressive, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday said that they are dampening the growth of the farm sector in the country. He said that the policies would reduce output instead of boosting it. His remarks came in a meeting with the state Agriculture Minister and officials to assess preparedness for rainy season crops.

373.title: Bodies of man, woman tied together by waist found in Narmada canal in Guj
373.article_body: The bodies of a man and woman were recovered from Narmada main canal near Gadit village in Gujarat's Halol. Police said they haven't been identified yet as no evidence was found on them. "It appears to be a prima facie case of...suicide," police added. The bodies were first spotted near Rameshra but were swept away towards Halol with the current.

374.title: Mumbai to witness high tides on 22 days this monsoon season: BMC
374.article_body: Mumbai will witness 22 days of high tide in four months of monsoon this year, according to BMC's Disaster Management Authority. High tides will occur on six days each in June and July and five days each in August and September, the data showed. The highest tide of 4.87 metres is expected on one day each in June and July.

375.title: Delhi's Ashram underpass to fully open to public on April 24
375.article_body: The 750-metre-long Ashram underpass in Delhi will be fully open to the public from April 24. The underpass, connecting central and south Delhi, will be inaugurated by Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday. "At present, traffic movement is allowed till 11 pm. Once the underpass is officially inaugurated, it will be open [throughout] the day." a PWD official said.

376.title: Aus scientists to power Tesla on 15,000-km trip with printed solar panels
376.article_body: Australian scientists will test using printed solar panels to run a Tesla on a 15,100-kilometre journey beginning in September. The team will use 18 of its printed plastic solar panels, each 18 metres (59 feet) long. They will roll out the panels beside the car to absorb sunlight when the car will be in need of a charge.

377.title: Posing as customers, 3 women, 1 man steal gold earrings & pendants in Punjab
377.article_body: Three women and one man allegedly stole two pairs of gold earrings and two pendants from jewellery shop in Ludhiana while posing as customers. Fraudsters allegedly engaged jeweller in conversation and also sent his employee to fetch water for them. They asked owner to show nose rings and earrings and pretended to not like anything before leaving with stolen jewellery.

378.title: Could've done better with bowling, RCB's 181 was 15-20 extra runs: Rahul
378.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul said they could've done better as they lost by 18 runs against RCB on Tuesday. "We started really well after getting two wickets in the first over...but [RCB's 181-run total] on [this] pitch was 15-20 extra runs we gave away...we couldn't really squeeze in the middle and with the bat as well," he added.

379.title: Bombay HC judge recuses from Elgar case, third to do so this year
379.article_body: Bombay High Court Justice Sadhana S Jadhav recused herself from hearing pleas related to the Bhima Koregaon-Elgar Parishad case in which several writers and activists are accused. Jadhav is the third judge to do so this year after Justice Prasanna B Varale and Justice S S Shinde recused themselves from hearing pleas related to the case.

380.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised cricket betting racket, 4 arrested
380.article_body: Hyderabad City Police busted an organised cricket betting racket and arrested four people. They seized seven cell phones, a TV with a setup box and remotes, one calculator, one notebook, one pen and ₹2.80 lakh in cash. A raid was conducted when the accused were running cricket betting in an organised manner in Venkateshwar Nagar, police said.

381.title: Ram Charan visits BSF camp in Amritsar; gets his personal chef to cook for them
381.article_body: Ram Charan, who is currently shooting for filmmaker Shankar's yet-to-be-titled upcoming film, spent the afternoon with the soldiers of the Border Security Force (BSF) in Khasa, Amritsar. Reportedly, Ram brought his personal chef to cook meal for all the soldiers on the campus. Sharing the pictures from the Amritsar's BSF campus, Ram wrote, "Inspiring afternoon spent listening to stories."

382.title: Ajay pranked crew during Runway 34's shoot; added Bhang in lassi: Hrishikesh
382.article_body: Actor Hrishikesh Pandey, who'll be seen in 'Runway 34', spoke about working with actor-director Ajay Devgn in the film. He said, "I wasn't expecting him to be so sweet...and wonderful. I thought he'd be stern and cut to cut." "Ajay sir is known as a prankster. On April Fool's Day, he added bhang in lassi, which everyone had," Hrishikesh added.

383.title: Wrote comedy on arrest, jokes came to mind as I reached police station: Munawar
383.article_body: Comedian and 'Lock Upp' contestant Munawar Faruqui said that he started writing his new comedy special on his arrest when he went to jail. "Jokes had started coming to my mind...when I reached the police station...I was in a very very bad condition...They were the worst days of my life...I was observing everything...and writing jokes about them," he added.

384.title: Indian Air Force successfully test fires BrahMos missile from Sukhoi Su-30MKI jet
384.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Tuesday successfully test-fired a BrahMos supersonic cruise missile from a Sukhoi Su-30MKI jet on the Eastern seaboard. The "live firing" of the missile was carried out in close coordination with the Indian Navy, the IAF said. The missile hit the target, a decommissioned Indian Navy ship, with accuracy and precision, officials said.

385.title: Ghaziabad earned ₹1,474 cr in liquor revenue in 2021-22, 3rd highest in UP
385.article_body: Ghaziabad earned ₹1,474 crore in liquor revenue in financial year 2021-22 which was the third-highest in UP behind Lucknow and Kanpur, excise department officials said. Ghaziabad residents consumed over 2.88 crore bottles of beer and over 1.30 crore bottles of Indian Made Foreign Liquor. "Revenue earned from liquor in 2021-22 has been the highest in five years," an official said.

386.title: 2 contract killers arrested in murder of 25-year-old man in Thane
386.article_body: Police have arrested two contract killers in the murder of a 25-year-old man in Thane. According to police, the deceased, identified as Mangesh Patil, had become a hurdle for his three relatives on their ancestral property issues in the Shil-Daighar area. Therefore, in order to get Patil killed, his relatives gave a contract of ₹50,000 to the killers, police added.

387.title: CSK players attend Conway's pre-wedding party wearing traditional attire, pics surface
387.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) contingent attended New Zealand batter Devon Conway's pre-wedding party wearing traditional attire in Mumbai's Trident Hotel. "Honestly a night I’ll never forget! Thank you so much to the CSK family for a lovely evening! Now onto the big day ahead," Conway wrote on Instagram. Conway and his longtime girlfriend Kim had got engaged in 2020.

388.title: Maria Sharapova pregnant with first child, shares pic of baby bump
388.article_body: Ex-world number one women's tennis player Maria Sharapova has announced that she's pregnant with her first child. Sharapova, who turned 35 on Tuesday, shared a picture of her baby bump on Instagram, writing, "Precious beginnings...Eating birthday cake for two has always been my specialty." The five-time Grand Slam champion got engaged to UK art dealer Alexander Gilkes in December 2020.

389.title: Netflix loses subscribers for 1st time in more than 10 years
389.article_body: The number of Netflix subscribers has fallen for the first time in more than a decade. The streaming company lost 200,000 members in the first three months of the year, the company said on Tuesday. Netflix's shares, already down more than 40% this year, tumbled as much as 27% to $256 in after-hours trading.

390.title: RCB go 2nd on IPL 2022 points table with 18-run win against LSG
390.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 18 runs to register their second win in a row. With this, RCB jumped to the second position on the IPL 2022 points table, while LSG have dropped to the fourth position. RCB captain Faf du Plessis top-scored in the match with 96(64), while Josh Hazlewood took four wickets.

391.title: 2 ex-business partners get into a fight, injured in shootout in WB
391.article_body: Two former business partners were injured in a shootout in West Bengal's Kolkata at Brahmapur area. Locals claimed it was the fallout of a TMC syndicate fight. However, the local councillor said, "There was personal enmity between the two and the firing took place due to personal problems."

392.title: 6.0 magnitude earthquake strikes Philippines' Mindanao island
392.article_body: The European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) on Tuesday said a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Mindanao island in the Philippines. No injuries or damage have been reported so far. The EMSC said the quake was recorded at a depth of 10 km. The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said aftershocks and damage are expected following the earthquake.

393.title: Captain of large Russian landing ship killed in Ukraine: Reports
393.article_body: The captain of a large Russian landing ship has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Governor of Sevastopol Mikhail Razvozhayev said Captain Alexander Chirva died from wounds he sustained during a battle with Ukrainian defenders. Captain Chirva was the commander of the Russian landing ship Caesar Kunikov which is a part of Russia's Black Sea fleet.

394.title: Maharashtra reports 137 new COVID-19 cases, three deaths
394.article_body: Maharashtra, on Tuesday, logged 137 new COVID-19 cases taking its tally to 78,76,041, the latest health department bulletin showed. There were three casualties reported as well, pushing the overall death tally to 1,47,830, according to the bulletin. Out of three new deaths in Maharashtra, Pune accounted for two deaths while Parbhani saw a single fatality.

395.title: Real estate prices may increase by 10-15% across India: CREDAI
395.article_body: Real estate industry body CREDAI on Tuesday said real estate prices have increased 5-8% due to a rise in construction costs and are expected to rise further by 5-7%, CREDAI National President HV Patodia said. There's been a steady increase in raw material costs in last two years and the Ukraine war further caused a rise in costs, he added.

396.title: Live-in relationships are leading to rise in sexual offences: MP High Court
396.article_body: The "bane of live-in relationship", a "byproduct" of rights conferred under Article 21 of the Constitution, is leading to a rise in sexual offences, Madhya Pradesh High Court said. It made the observation while rejecting anticipatory bail plea of a man accused of raping a woman. The complainant got pregnant and underwent abortions under pressure from her then partner.

397.title: Assam authorities alert districts to be prepared to tackle floods
397.article_body: The government of Assam has started the preparations to deal with the flood situation and alerted all the districts to be ready as well. "We have identified locations based on the last 10 years' flood data [and]...identified 11 circles that are spread over five districts that receive floods almost every year," CEO of Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

398.title: Odisha CM Patnaik sanctions ₹120 cr for Kendu leaf pluckers
398.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik sanctioned ₹120 crore for bonus and other allowances for Kendu leaf pluckers and other seasonal workers. A statement from the Chief Minister's office said, "It will benefit around 8 lakh Kendu leaf pluckers, binders and other seasonal staff." The state government also decided to increase the collection price of Kendu leaf for 2022.

399.title: US President Joe Biden should come to Ukraine: President Zelenskyy
399.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said US President Joe Biden "should come" to visit Ukraine. "It's his decision of course and they must consider the safety situation. But I think he's the leader of the United States and that's why he should come here to see," Zelenskyy said. The White House has since stated Biden has "no plans" to visit Ukraine.

400.title: MHA designates LeT commander Sheikh Sajad as terrorist under UAPA
400.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs designated Sheikh Sajad, a commander of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), as a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. The ministry stated in a notification that Sajad has been absconding in a case related to the recovery of arms and ammunition in Jammu and Kashmir. He has also been recruiting the youth of J&K into LeT.

401.title: Sri Lankan PM offers to hold talks with anti-govt protesters
401.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday offered to hold talks with anti-government protesters amid a severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Earlier, the protesters had said that they would only leave if PM Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa step down. Notably, the opposition has threatened to bring a no-confidence motion against the government over its handling of the crisis.
